  716. I spent a year suffering from adult hormonal cystic acne. 1-2 huge throbbing pimples 1-2x/month! It was psychologically devastating and physically painful too. I felt completely at its mercy. The worst part was that it seemed to have come out of nowhere-- I'm in my late 20s and had spent my life with occasional pimples but mostly very good skin (albeit fair, dry and very sensitive.) Anyway, I've finally found a routine that has VANISHED the cystic acne:<br /><br />1) I stopped consuming all processed sugar and gluten. I think this is what really stopped my body from \\"making\\" the acne in the first place. Try it for a month-- it's totally worth it (this from a sweet tooth.)<br />2) Tanda blue light 1-2x/day on problem areas. Kills bacteria deep inside the pore, which I think is what finally got rid of my stubborn existing acne cysts.<br />3) AZTEC HEALING CLAY facial 1-2X/week. I do not recommend using it with the apple cider vinegar to anyone with sensitive skin. Try mixing it with rosewater if you're looking for a thrill. Aztec does a great job exfoliating and releasing blackheads.<br />4) Mario Badescu drying lotion overnight about 3x/week. Excellent, overnight resolution of any smaller inflammations and great for blackheads too. A great partner for Aztec Healing Clay, I think.<br />5) Awaken My Senses Night Oil for Sensitive Skin-- a miracle moisturizer for my sensitive, sometimes dry face. I use it at least twice a day religiously and never use any other moisturizer any more. It's a beautiful, organic product from a wonderful little company I've fallen in love with, and it's great following each of the above drying treatments, especially after Aztec Healing. It's also rated 0 by the Environmental Working Group (zero is the best score they give, and beauty products rarely earn it.) When I use this it feels like I'm feeding my skin what it always wanted.<br /><br />I cannot recommend this routine more highly-- I wish someone had prescribed it to me a year ago. It's also very low-toxin, for those interested in controlling the amount of hazardous chemicals you're rubbing into your face each day (see EWG website.)<br /><br />Hope this helps some of you with similar skin!ear ago.   740. This mask is awesome. I have combination oily skin and I get acne break outs on my chin. So this is how I use the mask:<br />1. I steam my skin first, I have a Panasonic black head remover and I use that for extractions or I gently press on acne pimple to remove puss (don't torture yourself).<br />2. I mix it in an old hair dye mixing bowl. It's a powder, is very fine and can get everywhere so be careful. I found a scoop works best. It does not come with one , but pouring it into the mixing bowl is messy.<br />3. I mix equal parts with the organic apple cider vinegar. Do little bits at a time to get the right consistency.<br />4. Leave it on until it dries. I found that it tightens the skin as well as helps unclog pores. For me I noticed my fine lines diminishing after the second mask. I also use a thicker mask and again, I felt a noticeable tingle and tightening, but not the kind of tightening you get from drug store masks, where it tightens because it's drying you out. The first time I used it, it did make my face extremely sensitive and red the next day but after a couple of uses, that went away.<br /><br />Word of warning: This did bring quite a few pimples to the surface. I gave myself a 2 week window in which I allowed the mask to suck all the gunk out without thinking the mask itself was actually causing my skin to become worse. Now that I am over that 2 week hump, my skin is clear and I feel that the scars I have from older blemishes are lightening. I also feel that I have a glow that I didn't have before, which is great.<br /><br />The mask does pulsate/pull on the skin but other than that it isn't uncomfortable at all. I would recommend this mask to anyone who has some minor skin issues, as I don't know how it would work on major skin problems. All I would advise is to give it at least 2 weeks to see what type of results you get.<br /><br />**9/10 UPDATE: I seriously love this stuff!!!   766. Great Natural Healing Product.<br /><br />I have had this product in my bathroom cabinet for almost 20 years. Every time I get a breakout, a rash or a bug bite, I sprinkle a little of the powder into the lid of the container and swirl it around with either some water, some aloe vera juice, or apple cider vinegar, and apply it to my skin with either a finger tip or a small fan brush and it soaks up the problem in just a few minutes. Don't make it too thick and pastey, though. A thin solution will dry faster and not overzap your skin. Your skin will turn red underneath the mask, because it draws the blood to the surface. The thicker it is, the longer it takes to dry, the longer it remains on, the redder your skin will get. A light dose is best, I've found. With a thin layer you can actually see the effect of the oils getting drawn from your pores into the clay. Do not put it under your eyes as it is too drying for that sensitive area.<br /><br />Special use: After having experienced the scourge that is 'bed bugs', there comes a time where all your clothes and bedding are bed bug free [thank you pak-tite] but your body, itself, is not. If you lie down on your clean bedding, or put on your clean clothes you will start the cycle all over again. ARGH. Nightmare.<br /><br />My solution: Slather up your whole body with a thin solution of Aztec secret and apple cider vinegar. It burns like crazy, but suffocates the remaining bed bugs on/in your skin. Ahhhh, peace. Sound sleep & bye bye bed bugs. A life saver.<br /><br />I believe will always have this product in my medicine cabinet.

  793. As an esthetician with more than 20 years experience, I can tell you that this is an exceptional mask. If you've got highly sensitive or reactive skin, it may be too aggressive a mask for your skin; but for normal to oily to acneic, or thick sun damaged skin, this mask will do the trick. If you are sensitive and want to give it a try, use water instead of vinegar and start off leaving it on for 10 minutes; other skin types can leave it on for longer periods. No matter what instructions say, listen to your skin. If it starts to burn too much or if you become overly sensitive to it, try leaving in on for shorter periods. For those of us who can take it, go for it! It's wonderful! Your skin will pulsate, detox, and tighten. Blackheads...gone! Pimples...gone! With regular use, fine lines and wrinkles...gone! Don't be afraid if you skin is a little sensitive or red immediately afterwards, this will dissipate in 20 to 30 minutes. Spritz your face with a gentle toner to replace your acid mantle, it will calm and quench your skin. Follow with a good moisturizer. DO NOT use a moisturizer with alpha hydroxy acids until several days after applying this masks. Your skin will already be well exfoliated, you will see, after the clay mask. Good luck!
  794. My skin was extremely dry after using this product. Highly recommend to use a deep moisturizer afterwards. Not sure if it even works for what it is intended for since I haven't noticed any changes.
  795. I use this mask every couple of weeks, especially on my nose, to clean out and shrink the pores in my skin. I would give this product five stars, but there are a few issues I have with it that should be addressed:<br /><br />Pros?<br />The product works, plain and simple. Yes, my skin is soft after rinsing off, and yes, my pores are clean and smaller.<br />It feels great on my skin. There is something very soothing about hiding behind all that mud.<br />The price is reasonable, especially considering that I will be able to get 15 masks or so out of the jar.<br /><br />Cons?<br />This stuff will clog the crap out of your plumbing. I have not suffered an issue with it because I was careful, but it is impossible to clean up.<br />The mud is very, very hard to get off of my face. My advice to anyone reading this review is to have plenty of disposable paper towels on hand, because it is better that it ends up taking you ten minutes pulling it off your face with a bunch of paper towels, and then rinsing the last portions off in the shower, than to try to wash it off.<br />Mixing it takes forever, and in order to prevent lumps, you have to take your time. I was only able to prevent wasting most of it in lumps by using a super tiny whisk and mixing it in a cut-down paper cup, adding a very small amount at a time. In order to make this mask clay powder into true clay, I suggest starting with two to three tablespoons of water and adding a small amount of powder, and then mixing. Repeat until it is thick enough for you.<br /><br />Since the product is not overly expensive and works well, it is worth the trouble.

  911. After letting this dry completely, it was pretty painful to get off my face, even when it was wet and I did get a little bit of red bumps on the thinner layers of my skin like under my eyes and a little bit down my neck. I don't have sensitive skin at all either. It took a VERY long time to wash all of the clay off my face when I did get it wet. The only thing it did help with was getting rid of blackheads, so I suggest to only put it on areas that you have blackheads on, not your entire face like I did. And make sure to have a very good moisturizer after because it really dries up your skin. I would also avoid wearing makeup for the next couple of days because it may irritate/ make your skin look flaky. All in all though, it was the best blackhead remover I've tried yet. P.S only use water when you mix it, the vinegar will be too harsh on your skin.
  912. This might turn out to be a hefty review, so brace yourself.<br /><br />Are you braced?<br /><br />Okay, let's go.<br /><br />First off, I wanna say I'm a high school senior typing this on my mom's account because rules are for squares and I'm a triangle.<br />That being said, I've had troublesome pimples and blackheads and those massive geysers embedded in my skin for as long as I could remember. Sure, it was probably just a few years, but when you're one of the only teens with pizza-face in both your high schools, it seems like an eternity or two. And, yeah, I have the classic 'I've tried everything' story, I had a dermatologist, the whole nine yards. So I feel a lot of your guys' pain. :(<br /><br />Second, I guess I should start off with my experience in making this mass of mud.<br />You'll need more dirt than you think. That's cuz the vinegar dissolves some and leaves you with a dry, unmixed turd, so you have to keep adding and adjusting til the consistency's right. I went with a more whipped texture, like thick cool whip. :) According to some other reviews [ and believe me i read a novel's worth before i broke out my ten bucks ], you aren't supposed to mix with metal because it'll react with the vinegar. Well, I've had my fair share of school projects and I just took an old plastic paintbrush - you know, the ones you get for a dollar in an unnamed packaging - and used the end to mix because the bristles are held by this weird metal bracelet. It was kind of hard, since the end is just shy of the circumference of an ant's head, but it got the job done. When it was thoroughly mixed, I just used the brush end to slather it onto my face. A little cold, but it was fun. :) To wash - mind you, I used some cheap plastic bowl that probably held chicken fried rice at some point - I just rinsed the bristles and bowl as well as I could, using my fingers to break up stubborn chunks. I used warm water and swished my hand in the sink to make sure it was all more or less dissolved, then ran the tap a little longer to ensure no clay chunks were latching themselves in my s-pipe.<br /><br />I must say, the thinner you paint your layer, the quicker it dries. And I mean THE QUICKER IT DRIES. Like, it literally started drying on my cheek as I moved to my nose, haha. Simple fix, just paint some more on until your whole face is covered in a decent layer and there are few dry patches [ normally at the edges ].<br /><br />I can definitely vouch for the pulsating effects, as this felt like it was sucking the crud straight out of my pores. My face felt a little warm, but I'm sure I can attribute that to the blood vessels and circulation being enhanced or whatever.<br /><br />Now, the results.<br /><br />I guess I should mention I dolled my little brother up [ don't worry, he's got teen acne, too ] in green so we could both suffer for beauty. :)<br /><br />Taking it off wasn't too hard. What I did was soak a wash cloth and press it against my face until the mask was all wet again, then I used the same wash cloth to gently buff the clay off. It dissolved more easily that way and the whole process took about five minutes. I have one of those mini mesh strainer thingies in my sink, so I could see any clumps that weren't dissolved, but I surprisingly didn't have that problem! Woo, score for me. :D<br /><br />I had some redness after it was all washed off - mind you, I'm by no means fair-skinned - but unlike some of the other reviewers mine was gone when I finished gawking and ogling and touching the soft skin left behind by the mask and actually dried my face. You might want to pat your face dry as opposed to rubbing it.<br /><br />All in all, this mask is super and I'm so glad I bought it. :)lved, then ran the tap a little longer to ensure no clay chunks were latching themselves in my s-pipe.<br /><br />I must say, the thinner you paint your layer, the quicker it dries.   920. There are over 1K review on this product so I'm not sure if anyone is going to read this one, but for a face mask & it's price, this is great! My pores are getting smaller & my face is clear of any pimples.<br /><br />It's not an overnight miracle & I've been using it for the past month now. At first, my face broke out, but it cleared up in a few days. I've used many mud masks over the years & having my face pulse is pretty normal to me.<br /><br />I pour just a tad of apple cider vinegar in a plastic tupperwear bowl & add small amounts of the clay & mix with a plastic spoon until I get a smooth (not too runny!) foamy consistency. Then I smear it all over my face. I like to put mine on thick. The thicker it is, the longer it will take - up to 30 min. If you put it on thick, it will start to hurt your skin due to it tightening to be careful. Then I take a paper towel & run it under hot water (I like my water hot) & then just rub it off my face. My face will be red & craving moisture so then I'll put some anti-aging cream on (did you know you start to age at 14?).<br /><br />I never had \\"trouble\\" skin except large pores & they're starting to get smaller - but pores will always be there. They're hereditary. This isn't a \\"miracle\\" product for me like some of the reviews I have read, but it's a great cheap mud mask & I bet you get the same results using this as if you were to go to a spa. I've read that some people put in tea tree oil or they use this for their feet. I have yet to do that. I even read that some people EAT it.<br /><br />Overall, this is a cool product that I'll probably be using for the next few years.

  942. If you want to clear everything out of your skin, this will do it. I have dry skin so I don't use vinegar, I use water. A friend of mine, who suggested this to me, has oily skin, large pores and breaks out a lot, so she uses the vinegar, and it works really well for her.<br /><br />You do NOT have to use a lot. I put a very thin layer on my skin and it works just as well. Actually, better, because when I put it on thick, pieces of it would fall off my face. A thin layer does the trick, and it stays on your face even after it dries. Also, the less you use, the less it will clog your drains. It super tightens your skin, and my pores are noticeably smaller (and I never had large pores, but after using this and noticing the difference it makes, I guess my pores were getting bigger).<br /><br />Your skin will be dry when you are done whether or not you have dry or oily skin, so moisturize after. Your skin will absorb anything you use very quickly, so I recommend a great moisturizer. I use [[ASIN:B00BD822BI Bel Essence Anti Aging Treatment - Intensive All Natural Anti-Wrinkle, Facial Lift Skin Care Formula - 1.5oz]] because it is the best all natural anti-aging cream I have found, and it replenishes your skin with vitamins, fatty acids, and omega 3s that your skin needs to be healthy. I tried other drugstore brand moisturizers and anti-aging creams, and the Bel Essence gives me the best results that last - you don't go back to your &#34;before&#34; picture even if you stop for a short time (as if I would). The combination of completely cleaning your skin with this clay and then a great anti-aging cream is amazing. You will not believe how soft and smooth your skin is after this facial/cream, and your pores are immediately smaller. I did this every couple of days to start, to really clean my skin, then 1x or 2x a month. More is not necessarily better, remember, the clay removes EVERYTHING from your skin - the good and the bad. So make sure every time you use it, you replace the good to build your skin up. I found that the absolute best results were to use the clay before you shower at night, then after you get out of the shower, when your skin is warm, use the cream. It gets absorbed so much better and the results are the best. I LOVE this clay and the combination of the products has made a huge difference in my skin. The bonus is that after a couple of months, the fine lines on my face - eyes, forehead, lips are GONE. Love it.<br /><br />Update - the weather is getting a little cooler and drier now, so I don't do the mask as often, maybe once a week max, but the anti-aging cream I recommended, Bel Essence is amazing in the cooler and drier weather. My skin is still moisturized the whole day, and the cold weather used to cause lines to come back no matter what anti-aging product I used, but the bel essence keeps me as line free in the winter as I am in the summer. Between the mask and the Bel Essence, all those fine lines on my face - GONE. My skin is tighter, firmer, and smoother. The mask gets rid of the old skin beautifully, and the Bel Essence builds up the new. I've lost 5 years at least on my face.<br /><br />UPDATE - I've been using this awhile and I have some more tips. First, I use water, not vinegar. I do have some acne (my skin breaks out more in the summer), but it's not a bad condition and the vinegar irritates my skin. So if you have normal, dry or just slightly oily skin, I would start out with just water for the mix, and maybe try the vinegar. Vinegar will dry your skin!<br /><br />Second. I recommend using this once a week, twice a week at most. If you have oily skin, it can cause your skin to produce more oil (because you are drying out your skin when you use it). So be careful and judge how frequent use affects your skin. One of the big reasons I use the Bel Essence cream is because after using the clay, I put oil back into my skin, so I don't end up with super dry skin, and also, Idon't end up with super oily skin. Highly recommend the product for use with the clay - and the cream doesn't cause breakouts. I was a little hesitant to put oil on my skin, but it has only made my skin better, and it works better than any chemical anti-aging cream I have used.<br /><br />Third, even though I use a small amount, I sometimes end up with a little left over. I mix the clay in a container that I can store in the fridge so I can use it on my next treatment.<br /><br />I've been using both products for quite some time now, and my skin glows, is soft, line free (thank you Bel Essence), and the clay also helps to minimize pores so my skin is smoother looking. Since I break out in the summer a bit, I use it twice a week, and it has helped more than anything else to keep my breakouts to a minimum.<br /><br />This is a routine I will be keeping forever and ever. (Don't discontinue your products Indian Clay and Bel Essence!) I get a lot of compliments of how good I look, people I run into always comment on my great skin and especially, how young I look. For someone who has up and down skin conditions, it is heaven to hear this!don't end up with super oily skin.   987. I usually don't write reviews and especially not in so much detail, but this stuff helped me, so why not share the experience and hopefully help someone else...<br /><br />I tried the mask out for the 1st time last night. I have recently developed bad adult acne; the kind with about 100 tiny pimples that give your face a horrible texture in addition to regular larger pimples here and there. I came across this product and thought why not? It has some too good to be true reviews along with some normal and of course bad ones. And I was starting to get a little desperate because my normal serums have not been working.<br /><br />Not being sure of how much I needed to make, I mixed 1 Tbsp + 1 tsp each of the clay and Vitaminshoppe brand unfiltered apple cider vinegar. It turned out to be enough to put a pretty thick mask layer on my face and a thinner, more normal layer on my neck. (I will probably reduce to just 1 Tbsp each next time.) So, I highly recommend not trying to multi-task while wearing the mask, like tucking your child into bed... This is not your usual mask. It does tighten to the point of it not being comfortable to move around; and forget trying to talk. So the mask got really tight on my face. I did feel the pulsating on my nose. The thinner layer on my neck got itchy because of the vinegar (which if you didn't know is a natural antibacterial and therefore can burn a little anyway...) And of course, I wore the mask longer than recommended until it started to burn a little--probably closer to 30 minutes.<br /><br />Because of the extra thickness of the mask, it was harder and messier to get off than other masks. I first tried my usual warm wet washcloth to start wiping the mask off. That actually hurt. I immediately realized I would need a lot more water to loosen up the clay, so I did end up hanging my head over the tub rinsing with warm water and my hands. When most of the clay was off, then I reverted back to the washcloth method.<br /><br />To my surprise, my face was much smoother. All of the tiny pimples were gone. The other ones were smaller and less swollen. My face wasn't really red at all like other people described. I could tell my face was a little dry, so I put on a mild face moisturizer...I think it was a Ponds anti-aging lotion. With a still skeptical attitude, I decided to wait until the morning to see if the results stuck through the night. And once again, to my surprise, the results remained.<br /><br />So it did not magically clear up my entire face in 30 minutes, but it did significantly reduce what was on it. It was well worth the smoother skin and reduced acne. I may try it again for the next few nights to see if it will completely clear up my face, even though I remember reading somewhere that you should not use it too often because of its potency. I will just make sure to moisturize... :)<br /><br />----So an update after using it a few of times----<br />I now know what other people are talking about with the burning sensation. But only because I still leave the mask on way longer than the recommended time. I actually leave it on for as long as I can stand it. So my face does turn red in some spots but fades away. It doesn't bother me since I do this at night before bed... The mask has continued to help minimize my acne, but it has not made it all disappear. However, I have noticed that my face looks somewhat healthier, maybe a little glowy, and younger. Yes, even my fine lines on my forehead have become less noticeable. Maybe it is from my anti-aging lotion getting sucked into my dry pores. I don't know. But, needless to say, I am still pleased with this product.<br />To my surprise, my face was much smoother. All of the tiny pimples were gone. The other ones were smaller and less swollen. My face wasn't really red at all like other people described. I could tell my face was a little dry, so I put on a mild face moisturizer...I think it was a Ponds anti-aging lotion. With a still skeptical attitude, I decided to wait until the morning to see if the results stuck through the night. And once again, to my surprise, the results remained.<br /><br />So it did not magically clear up my entire face in 30 minutes, but it did significantly reduce what was on it. It was well worth the smoother skin and reduced acne. I may try it again for the next few nights to see if it will completely clear up my face, even though I remember reading somewhere that you should not use it too often because of its potency. I will just make sure to moisturize... :)<br /><br />----So an update after using it a few of times----<br />I now know what other people are talking about with the burning sensation. But only because I still leave the mask on way longer than the recommended time. I actually leave it on for as long as I can stand it. So my face does turn red in some spots but fades away. It doesn't bother me since I do this at night before bed... The mask has continued to help minimize my acne, but it has not made it all disappear. However, I have noticed that my face looks somewhat healthier, maybe a little glowy, and younger. Yes, even my fine lines on my forehead have become less noticeable. Maybe it is from my anti-aging lotion getting sucked into my dry pores. I don't know. But, needless to say, I am still pleased with this product.

It does get a little red for about 30 minutes, and I apply lotion to remoisturize, but it works like a charm! I'm not going to start saying it \\"sucks everything from your pores!\\" Because that's a bunch of crap, but whatever it does, my skin likes it!<br /><br />Would recommend. For those saying they had a reaction, it IS very basic and can be harsh, so it's probably worth testing on a small area first.
  1001. I love this product!!!! I Will order again!!!! My face feels so clean and tight!!!! Its good for acne and bug bites sooo i highly suggest it to anyone who has acne or gets the occasional bug bite and just wants to treat themselves to a nice spa treatment.
  1002. I've used this mask about 7 times. Each time, I've only used it with water (I may try the vinegar in the future). I do love how soft it leaves my face and for me it helps with blackheads, but I have to run my nails over them for the dirt to come out (probably not the best way to go about it lol). Lately I've been using it to counteract some medicinal side-effects (i.e dry skin & washed out complexion) as well as to calm my acne when it gets really bad. It seems to help give me back my \\"youthful glow\\" and I use it whenever I want my face to look more refreshed (keep in mind though, it isn't a magic cure-all and certainly doesn't repair me 100%, but a 40-50% improvement is fine for me). It also doesn't get rid of my acne, it just makes it stop itching and being so inflamed. And no, I have never felt a \\"pulsing and tingling\\" just mud tightening on my face. It's a little messy the first couple of times, but once you learn how to mix it, it's not bad (the clumpiness is a pain though).
  1003. This stuff is great. It does take a few times to get used to the texture. My face feels wonderful after I use it.
  1004. This product is absolutely amazing. I use it once or twice a week, depending on how I feel about my skin. Pair this with Apple Cider Vinegar, I don't think it would give the same results with water or any other liquid you would use. Leave it on for about 35 minutes, you'll know when to take it off (your forehead will begin to itch). Your skin will be red for like 3 hrs, so I recommend using it before you go to bed. When you wake up in the morning, your skin will be so soft. I love this stuff, it really helps repair your skin overnight and you will see/feel a difference the morning after. I have shared this product will a lot of my friends and family and they all have their own bottles of [[ASIN:B0014P8L9W Aztec Secret - Indian Healing Clay, 1 lb clay]]. So happy I gave this stuff a chance, I seriously don't know what I would do without it now.

  1006. i LOVE using any type of natural clay in my skincare regimen. but this so far is my favorite. as others have mentioned its definitely strong but it does the job! i usually am preferential to mud masks or french green clay. but when \\"that time of the month\\" comes around and the hormonal acne rears its ugly head all i have to do is break out this bad boy and it stops it in its tracks.
  1007. Warning--DON'T peel bits of this mask off as some have suggested. I did just that, thinking I would save my drain from being clogged and maybe even pull some gunk out of my face, but all I got were some really nasty splotches and bruises on my face--probably made worse by the fact that I used the mask two days in a row. Not smart, I know.<br /><br />And not the product's fault, because the parts of my face that aren't bruised look great. It doesn't look like a fairy waved her wand and made all my blemishes go away, but my face is smooth, and the bumpy clogged pores I had everywhere have shrunk a good deal. The few zits I had have shrunk as well.<br /><br />I always go overboard when I first get a new skincare product, and it happened to backfire really terribly in this case. Hopefully the bruising goes away soon. Moral of the story: use this stuff sparingly and carefully, and it works great.
  1008. At end of day, once a week: Mix 2 tsp clay with 2 tsp apple cider vinegar, mix into a paste with a small rubber spatula in a tiny bowl. Spread over clean, dry face, let dry. You will feel like your blood is rushing to your face (it is) and lots of tingling and maybe even a teensy itch here and there (resist the urge to scratch or use a toothpick to satisfy little urges). Leave on until it is good and dry. Use a good hot-as-you-can-stand-it wet, rough washcloth to repeatedly wipe it off, then wash your face in warm water, finish in cool water. You WILL see a huge difference in your pore size and the clarity of your skin. It is very drying by design, so I recommend following it up with your favorite LIGHT nighttime moisturizer and going night-night. Continue to keep your face clean and moisturized throughout the week and repeat again in 7 days.
  1009. I ordered this product, which was a bit cheaper, along with my vitamins from another site. I went pretty much by the reviews as I stumbled on it during a search for something else otherwise I still would not even know about it.<br /><br />First I must say it was little disconcerting to hear the sizzle when mixing this with apple cider vinegar but I gave it a shot anyway (you only need a small bit of this stuff and we mixed a bit too much). My teenage daughter and I tried it, I put mine on in two or three layers so it was pretty thick, she maybe did 1.5 layers. Now she was still talking and laughing during the wait, I had went downstairs and my facial movements were still so mine dried to a thick mask (though it later cracked and I looked like an alien from out of space). My daughter's, I later saw, had some peeled off especially around her mouth because of facial movements and constant touching of her face.<br /><br />I kept mine on between 25 to 35 minutes when I felt it completely dry. During the later time of the drying I did feel the pulsating, pulling, tightening, squeezing and almost hurting of my face (if I moved it), and further when I went to wash it off I saw that my lips were puckered. I bent into the sink and turned on very warm water and started slowly washing my face, no rubbing just gently moving the water over the mask until it started 'melting' and washed off completely with no chunks of clay in my sink, it just blending into water down the drain like normal. My daughter on the other hand was trying to peel it off but she did what I did and found it easier. I don't think peeling it off is a good or healthy idea as I would think it more damaging that way.<br /><br />So afterwards I had red skin but after applying a moisturizer (a lot) it eventually went away and I never got any bumps or any bad reaction. My face felt smooth though dry and the next day it even felt smaller (I'm sure that was my imagination), as the days went on (we only plan on using it once a week) though my face felt more smoother, even-toned and even firmer. My daughter's face definitely looked brighter from the beginning but that might have been due to lack of even washing her face on a regular basis but she liked it's effect and wants to do it again.<br /><br />Overall I would say that the whole experience with waiting for the mask to dry was a bit scary weird (more due to first experience) but not bad as after washing my face I felt that the experience had really gotten the blood circulating in my face which is a good thing. The after effects are definitely the goal which has been accomplished, though I'm not sure about blackheads (reason for the 4 stars) as I would think one would need to do a minor facial scrub maybe the day afterwards (or maybe up to 6 hours later) to get them out while they are still 'loosen' from the mask but I don't think it is something that happens overnight (at least not for me) from just doing the mask but a combination of activities in conjunction with this.<br /><br />We are definitely looking forward to trying it again and will keep an eye on the 'benefits' of doing it over a period of time and report back if anything is out of the ordinary.h my face felt more smoother, even-toned and even firmer. My daughter's face definitely looked brighter from the beginning but that might have been due to lack of even washing her face on a regular basis but she liked it's effect and wants to do it again. Overall I would say that the whole experience with waiting for the mask to dry was a bit scary weird (more due to first experience) but not bad as after washing my face I felt that the experience had really gotten the blood circulating in my face which is a good thing. The after effects are definitely the goal which has been accomplished, though I'm not sure about blackheads (reason for the 4 stars) as I would think one would need to do a minor facial scrub maybe the day afterwards (or maybe up to 6 hours later) to get them out while they are still 'loosen' from the mask but I don't think it is something that happens overnight (at least not for me) from just doing the mask but a combination of activities in conjunction with this.   1014. I've never written a review for anything before but I just had to for this product...I have always had major skin problems since I was young girl (I broke out at like 10 years old and so I have always hated my skin). My skin is a weird combo of being oily and yet drying out relatively easily. While I'm not saying it's a miracle cure all, this stuff has done wonders for shrinking my pores and getting rid of black heads! My face is practically blackhead free =) It may have also helped to regulate the oil production in my face (though that could be due to the witch hazel I use, not sure) My friend even told me my skin was looking better. Now if it could get rid of the acne and scars too, then it would be the perfect product, but regardless it is awesome.<br /><br />While some people say you can use it with water, I really don't recommend it. Apple cider vinegar gets it to a nice smooth consistency that pulsates on the skin and dries relatively even. You can easily pull it off the skin which I like to think removes the blackheads. Whereas the water mixture was harder to mix, came out clumpy, latched on to my skin and could not be removed as easily. I had to aggressively wash it off and it took so much longer to do. I like to wait until it's almost completely dry to remove or it doesn't have the same effect or feel. My skin feels a lot cleaner and smoother when I leave it on longer.<br /><br />I have been using the mask for about 4-5 months now, once a week or before special or major events...and I'm still on the same jar (only about 1/2 way through it). It's definitely worth the money spent.
  1015. I have used this facial mask 3-4 times since I received it two weeks ago. I have tried it with water and with warm milk with equally nice results. I haven't yet tried to mix it with apple cider vinegar, but plan to soon. First off, I personally find the suggestion that you apply it in a layer 1/4 to 1/2 inch think to be FAR too thick. I apply a layer about 1/8 of an inch thick and that is plenty. A little goes a long way - I would estimate that 2 tbsp. of clay is sufficient. It definitely gives that pulling/tugging sensation as it dries, and I leave it on as long as I can manage (about 10-15 minutes). As it dries, it tends to make my face itch like crazy and I usually end up running to the bathroom to rinse it off. The first couple of times I used it, it left my face a bit pink, but the more times I have used it, the less my skin seems to react this way. When I used it today, my face wasn't flushed at all. A lot of people who have reviewed this product express that they like the pulling/tugging/pulsating (itching) feeling...as they can feel it working. I find it rather uncomfortable, but the results are well worth it. After I rinse off the mask with a warm, damp washcloth and moisturize, my skin literally feels like butter, my pores are visibilly reduced, and my overall tone is improved.<br /><br />I will continue to use this mask faithfully, experimenting with different liquid mixers despite the unpleasant feeling as it dries because the results are so impressive. Today I washed with Cetophil, followed it with 100% natural witchhazel toner (Dickinson's), applied the mask for 12 minutes, and finished with Sweet Blessed Bee Magic skin moisturizer. I can't stop touching my face - it is so incredibly smooth and luscious feeling. My makeup applies so beautifully after I've treated myself with this mask. I do recommend this to everyone...as long as you can stand the icky feeling.<br /><br />I would have given this product 5 stars if it didn't itch so much :(

  1020. I wanted to use this for a couple weeks before I gave a good review on it. So here we go.<br /><br />1. Don't expect totally miraculous results right away. It takes time for some things. This cleared up the blackheads in my nose really quickly and that was pretty awesome, but I had a lot of closed comedones (acne that isn't inflamed, but is just a bump under the skin. like an inactive zit) that needed to &#34;purge.&#34; There's a difference between your skin getting rid of these little comedones and having a reaction to a product, so make sure you watch and know which one it is.<br /><br />2. I have oily skin, and leave it on my face for about twenty minutes. I shower at night and don't wash my hair every day, so for the first couple weeks I used the mask on nights I didn't wash my hair. I'm going to start cutting back now. It takes out the bad but it also takes out the good<br /><br />3. I haven't had a problem with clogged drains. Yet.<br /><br />4. I use Bragg vinegar and usually start with a 1:1 ratio and add a little bit more clay. I make it in batches and store it in my fridge, and the mixture does absorb some of the liquids after it sits for a little bit<br /><br />5. Leave it on your face until you feel the pulsating, and then leave it on a little bit longer. The pulsating is blood being drawn up to your skin. Your pulse and the suction-y feeling on your face will have the same rate since it's the same thing!<br /><br />6. You definitely don't need a 1/4 inch mask. Find whatever works for you. Apply it so you can't see your skin underneath the clay, but not so thick that it'll fall off<br /><br />OVERALL:<br />buy this. give it time. it will work for you unless you're allergic. don't just give up immediately, because this is not a one time miracle cure. good things take time, and this is worth the wait!

  1034. This I think could last you forever and it's definitely a great mask. It does &#34;pulsate&#34; but I wouldn't describe it as painful. It is hard to wipe off, so I would have a warm/steamed towel ready to soften it up once you want to remove it. This product is not for someone who wants a quick and easy facial. It takes effort but I think it's well worth it. You will not be able to make facial expressions comfortable once it is dry, so do leave plenty of time to make a facial, have it dry completely, and then to remove it. It takes practice to get the hang of removing it, so expect dirty sinks and towels for a while until you figure out the best way. Also note, a little goes a long way. So I would advise against using a heaping tablespoon of product and equal amounts of apple cider vinegar. Otherwise you will have tons left over. I have put excess in the fridge and used it later with no ill effects but I don't suspect it would last indefinitely.

Your face will be red, but it goes away within the hour. My skin was so soft and the swelling of the blemishes had diminished. Next I then washed my face with my regular cleanser, which I recommend since this mask draws out impurities and you dont want those impurities to rest on your skin and cause further break outs. I finished with my moisturizer and then headed off to bed. Upon waking up my skin was clear! Now I use this once a week just to keep the impurities and oils from building up and I swear my skin has changed. I would recommend, but use it carefully because it is so powerful.
  1069. Used this for the first time today. The jar arrived with a bar code attached on the back directions, so I could not read them. I went on Amazon and asked the question online.   1099. I read about this on a beauty blogger's page and thought I'd give it a try. I mixed it up in a plastic bowl with a stainless steel spoon (only now reading that I should have used a plastic spoon?!) and went with a small amount of clay and just started adding water until I had a somewhat soupy mixture. I didn't want a thick layer on my face (so basically I did not follow the directions). I left it on for about 20 minutes and it had hardened in some areas, but not others (even though the layer was pretty thin). To remove, I wet a washcloth and applied that to my face for a few minutes, splashed water on my face several times, then alternated both until it was all removed. It definitely took some time though - the clay really sticks to your face! And even though I read that your face may be red after you remove it, I was still shocked to see how red!! It looked like I had been out in the sun all day. Yikes! I applied some argan oil over my face (having read that you should moisturize after). Over the course of an hour, the redness dissipated. All in all, this was a great mask. I probably wouldn't do it more than once a week for my skin type. I'm actually looking forward to using it on bites/stings this summer to see if it works in that regard.

It really does pulsate, and it really will freeze your face into whatever position you lie in for half an hour.<br /><br />6. DO NOT APPLY IT THICK. The directions say to apply it I believe up to 1/2 inch... really? I use a soft bristled toothbrush from the dollar store (couldn't find a brush), and brush a thin layer on my skin. Just enough for complete coverage and not enough for it to be caked on and dripping off.<br /><br />7. TIP: if you have extra in your bowl after mixing it and have no way to store it (in otherwords your just going to throw it out) DO NOT rinse it into your sink. Just set it aside (I throw it under my bathroom sink) and in 4-5 hours it hardens up and I just scrape it into the trash. Remember, it's mud - you don't want to clog your sinks!<br /><br />Hope this helps anyone reading this! I say it's worth every penny.   1107. I like to use this once a week to clean my face and pull out toxins for quick removal. To begin, I will steam my face to open my pores by applying a towel that has been moistened with hot water. I mix a very miniscule amount of powder, maybe 1/2 tsp with bentonite clay liquid. I figure, mixing liquid bentonite with powder bentonite can deliver the most amount of detoxifying properties. Plus, the liquid is creamy and helps the clay to forms the smoothest texture. I found that using water would either create something too runny or too clumpy. I still do get some clumps with my method, so I apply the clumpy bits to areas of my face that are more acne prone. I save the glass bowl with its remaining residue for the next treatment, so as not to waste any of it. To prevent clogging my drains, I take a bowl of warm water and dip a towel into it for removal. Then I dump the water outside. My face always feels a bit tight and dry after use, but also clean and exfoliated. To alleviate the dry sensation, I apply a mixture of olive oil and coconut oil afterwards. This is an affordable way to pamper yourself and keep your skin in mint condition.

  1140. A friend and I use this for our weekly facials. I have oily skin, she has dry skin, so this review is for both skin types.<br /><br />First, this product works well for both. For dry skin, I recommend mixing with vinegar diluted with some water and a very little oil (I add [[ASIN:B007VEPVZC Bel Essence - (2oz) 100% All-Natural, Organic Anti-Wrinkle Oil Treatment with Argan, Grapeseed and Avocado Oil]] - about 10 drops), it will not be as harsh on dry or sensitive skin. For oily skin, add the recommended vinegar. My friend uses a little less than the recommended amount and also adds about 5-10 drops of the oil, and finds that it has a softening effect on the skin.<br /><br />This product will completely clean your skin. Whether oily or dry, your pores will be cleaned out and tightened and your skin will be bright and clean.<br /><br />Do NOT use a lot, a very thin layer on my skin works well, too much, and sometimes the clay falls off before it dries completely (and you go through the product faster, which isn't necessary). A little bit also makes it easier to get off your skin when it dries and you don't have chunks of clay going down your drain.<br /><br />Both of us found that our skin was dry when we washed the clay off. Even oily skin will be dry, and for oily skin, this can be a problem. If you strip the oil from your skin, your skin will start over producing oil, so you end up making your oily skin problem worse. You need to rehydrate your skin after use, and since you have completely cleaned your face, it will absorb any product quickly. I recommend a great moisturizer. I use [[ASIN:B00IIPI6CS Bel Essence Intensive Anti Aging Treatment - All-Natural Cream for Erasing Wrinkles. Lift, Firm, Tighten Facial Skin and Fade Fine Lines - 1.5oz]] because it is the best all natural anti-aging cream I have found, it's oil based, so it gives your skin what it needs and doesn't encourage over production of oil. It also has vitamins, fatty acids, and omega 3s that your skin needs to build healthy skin - I especially like that. My friend also uses it, and finds that after the facial, this gives her great results. I've used other big brand moisturizers, but they don't have long term results. The Bel Essence had given both of us great skin that has lasted for months. The clay keeps your skin clear, and then putting the natural moisturizer on your skin (and using a little of the oil in the clay), has given both of us amazing skin, soft, smooth and your pores are noticeably smaller.<br /><br />HERE'S THE BEST PART: If you have lines and wrinkles already, within a couple of weeks of using the two products you will see a HUGE difference. After a month of using both, the small lines around my eyes and on my upper lip were Gone Gone Gone. And the deeper lines on my forehead, were well on their way of disappearing - started getting shorter, and less deep, after a month, instead of two deep, straight lines across my forehead, I had one barely there line and the other was a shorter, broken line. Can't wait to see what the clay and bel essence do after a couple more months.<br /><br />When we first started this routine, we did it twice a week. Quickly dropped to once a week because the effects of both the clay and the moisturizer lasted. After a few months, I'm doing this between 3-4 times a month depending on my activity. My oily skin friend still sticks to once a week, but sometimes will go a couple of days longer between facials. The cream I use every day. VERY little in the morning (I put make up on top of it, so don't want to use too much) and then a normal application in the evening.<br /><br />Don't overdo, your skin gets stripped every time you use the clay, so you have to give your skin time to recover. I find that doing this routine at night before I shower is easier (you rinse off the clay in the shower), however, I usually wipe a lot of the clay off with a paper towel before jumping in the shower, just to be safe that I don't clog the drain. When your skin is warm from the shower, it absorbs the anti-aging cream even better. This is an EXCELLENT combination. My skin tone is even, and even better, the fine lines around my eyes, mouth and on my forehead are completely gone. Same with my friend - her skin responded even better to the combination and her lines even on her forehead are almost gone. If you want to put off aging, this is the way to do it! My friend has fewer breakouts, and she has also found that her skin is not as oily between facials. We both get compliments on our skin (friends ask me what foundation I use - NONE - because they tell me my skin is so great looking I have to be using a new makeup. NO, just great skin care.) What sells me on both the Indian Clay and the Bel Essence is that it works just as well on both dry and oily skin. Can't recommend this combination of products highly enough.r, it absorbs the anti-aging cream even better. This is an EXCELLENT combination. My skin tone is even, and even better, the fine lines around my eyes, mouth and on my forehead are completely gone. My friend has fewer breakouts, and she has also found that her skin is not as oily between facials. We both get compliments on our skin (friends ask me what foundation I use - NONE - because they tell me my skin is so great looking I have to be using a new makeup. NO, just great skin care.) What sells me on both the Indian Clay and the Bel Essence is that it works just as well on both dry and oily skin. Can't recommend this combination of products highly enough.

  1160. This mask is amazing. You can literally see and feel it pulling impurities out of your pores. I don't put it as thick as they specify on the jar because it would take forever to dry. I do apply a good amount of it and leave it on for at least 30-40 minutes. Your face gets so tight that it almost feels painful but it's totally worth it. Just one tip if you're rinsing the mask off in your sink: after awhile, all that clay going down the drain will clog it, so what I do (since the mask tends to come off in pieces and not dissolve in water) is I take a full sheet of paper towel, like Bounty (you need a durable brand) and place it in the sink so that as I rinse, all the chunks of mask collect in the paper towel and I save my drain from getting clogged. Once I finish, I just gather the paper towel and the clay pieces and throw it out. Easy peasy!
  1161. I wouldn't have wasted my money.<br /><br />First off, it's a powder that you mix with either water or apple cider vinegar to make a mask consistency. If you mix it with water (hot or cold - it doesn't make a difference) it doesn't mix together. It's chunky and gross and it doesn't go on your skin right. If you mix it with the apple cider vinegar, it mixes very well, but you have to deal with the disgusting smell of vinegar.<br /><br />Second, the whole \\"feel your skin pulsate\\" or whatever everyone's saying is more like \\"feel your skin BURN.\\" It freaking burns!! Thinking about your skin pulsating (at least to me) is feeling like your face is being massaged, not feeling like your skin is burning off.<br /><br />Third, washing this stuff off is a joke. If you mix it with water, it washes off a little easier just because it never formed a very good mask/paste so it's a bit easier than having to scrape it off when you use the apple cider vinegar. I just spent 20 minutes with the mask (mixed with the vinegar) on my face and then another 20 minutes trying to wash the crap off. No matter how thick/thin you put it on, it still hurts to wash off (though it hurts worse if you put it on thin.. If you put it on thick, parts of it are easy to scrape/peel off).<br /><br />Fourth, the redness after using it is kinda scary! I thought I was having an allergic reaction the first time I used it. I have acne.. Pimples, zits, black heads, big pores, you name it. Well, it made the bumps lay down for a few hours (which was exciting at first because I had no idea they'd pop back up) and it kinda \\"hid\\" my black heads (I probably still had clay in my pores).<br /><br />The only reason this is getting 2 stars instead of 1 is because my skin does feel clean after I use it. To me, it's not some magical awesome mask that's gonna solve all your skin issues - it's just a mask to clean your skin. And it's not one of those relaxing masks you'd want at a girls night or during a massage (unless you like it when your face is burning and you can't move it because it keeps getting tighter and tighter).<br /><br />I wouldn't recommend this product. I know everyone has different skin and it may work for other people in different ways, but with my sensitive skin, it's not worth the trouble.ke it when your face is burning and you can't move it because it keeps getting tighter and tighter).<br /><br />I wouldn't recommend this product. I know everyone has different skin and it may work for other people in different ways, but with my sensitive skin, it's not worth the trouble.

  1163. I'm very satisfied with this product. A few things to note on usage.<br /><br />1. Use Apple cider vinegar to mix it, if you use water it'll clump and be difficult to mix/wash down the drain.<br />2. Rather than try to measure out the amount of clay and apple cider and vinegar with a spoon, simply pour desired amount of clay and SLOWLY add ACV and mix with each pour until desired consistency is reached.<br />3. More product used the thicker and stronger the throbbing action is<br />4. It is very drying, so I like to first wash/dry my face and apply a layer of Extra-virgin Coconut oil for 15 minutes before applying the mask<br />5. If it's a very THICK mask, it's best to just hop in a shower, whereas a thin mask may be washed off at the sink.<br />6. Apply moisturizer after application of the mask<br />7. Don't use it everyday...<br />8. I LOVE IT!
  1164. I bought this to use in a DIY deodorant recipe, specifically to quit using standard retail deodorants which rely on aluminum.<br /><br />The good news: it works great!<br />The bad news: the chemical formula for calcium bentonite clay is (Na,Ca) (Al,Mg)6(Si4010)3(OH)6-nH20. Bentonite is an absorbent aluminium phyllosilicate. The &#34;Al&#34; and the &#34;aluminium&#34; both tell the bad news: part of why it is effective is because of its aluminum makeup.<br /><br />If you are okay with absorbing aluminum into your system, by all means, use this product. I, for one, will not use it as a face mask, and will NOT use it in future deodorant recipes.

  1174. Okay people - I always do my research before buying a new product. I read up, down, sideways, and backwards before buying this. I have been making my own facial masks for years, using ingredients that we all probably have located in our kitchens. Natural is the ONLY way to go in way of skin care, some people might disagree with my there, but to each their own. No one knows your skin as well as YOU do - you are the one living under there. Anyways, I am a licensed cosmologist, and unfortunately through the every day use of harsh chemicals found in everyday products, I developed a major allergy. All things from shampoo to lotion to body sprays, make me break out and itch, turning red from head to toe. It was quite embarrassing and annoying to say the least. Over the years, I have weeded out almost all of chemical products to replace them with things that are all natural, and that I can make on my own. Not only has this saved me lots of money, but I have almost completely rid myself of my skin irritations. I am always on the look out for new, natural products that I haven't tried before. I came across this clay through Amazon, and like I said, I researched till I was blue in the face. I decided to give it a shot.<br /><br />WOW. You really can feel the mask PULSATING against your skin, drawing out whatever lurks deep down in there. I have a pretty clean, chemical free lifestyle, but this mask was still able to reach down deep and draw out impurities. I peeled the dry mask off of my nose, and could see my blackheads coming with it, like you would in a Biore pore strip. It was pretty amazing.<br /><br />Ladies and Gents, if you break out after using this product ONE time, please do not feel discouraged. Simple, as other reviews have stated, the mask is drawing all of the dirt to the top of the skin. Hang in there, it takes time for your skin and body to push out all of the gunk. Give it a chance to really work.<br /><br />You can also use this product to take a detox bath, which I have yet to try but will definitely do so soon. You could also put it in a foot soak, make it thinner to do hair/scalp treatment, or put it over any part of your body you'd like to detox.<br /><br />My next goal is to find a good food grade clay, to take to detox the inside of the body. People (and animals) have been detoxing with clay for centuries. Unfortunately, Aztec Secret Indian Healing Clay, is not food grade, and for external use only. But I would 100% recommend for anyone to try this clay. Our skin and bodies are not meant to have chemicals slathered all over them from night till day! This really DETOXES you, so be prepared. Also - I would recommend to put a moisturizer on ASAP once you take the mask off, as it can be drying. I used organic jojoba, or my second fave organic coconut oil. Happy detoxing!<br /><br />****UPDATE 12/14/13****<br /><br />I still LOVE this mask, and I even got my man to used it. I must say....PLEASE do not OVER USE. I did make that mistake. My skin shriveled and dried up, and was very flakey. I got over excited at the wonderful benefits that I saw in my first few times using this product. This mask REALY gets in there and SUCKS out everything, so please do not over use. I would say after your first few times, maybe once every 2.5 weeks will be enough. The healing process took a while, but I was able to speed it up with my dry bush. After the flakes were gone, my nice healthy skin was back. I highly recommend, just please do not get too overzealous with this. Its far too powerful! Hope this helps :)h, which I have yet to try but will definitely do so soon. You could also put it in a foot soak, make it thinner to do hair/scalp treatment, or put it over any part of your body you'd like to detox.<br /><br />My next goal is to find a good food grade clay, to take to detox the inside of the body. People (and animals) have been detoxing with clay for centuries. Unfortunately, Aztec Secret Indian Healing Clay, is not food grade, and for external use only. But I would 100% recommend for anyone to try this clay. Our skin and bodies are not meant to have chemicals slathered all over them from night till day! This really DETOXES you, so be prepared. I have some ACV diluted with water 50/50 already in my bathroom and use this. It works! Then, I tear open the plastic bag, get the clay on my fingers and apply to my face.   1205. So as a 22 year old female college student, I break out here and there(usually stress or hormones). Sometimes a little, sometimes a lot. I figured I would give this a shot to complement with my current skin routine. I currently use epiduo gel from my dermatologist as a topical cream and a low dose pill for my hormonal acne. I mainly wanted to try this to give my skin a &#34;detox&#34; pretty much. I have never had a facial so I know this is probably the closest my skins ever gotten to a detox. What I did was mix 1/4 cup water and 1/4 clay in a plastic bowl and mixed it with a plastic spoon. It was very lumpy so I added more water but that didn't help much. What I did was put the lumpy mix on my face/neck and rubbed it in circular motions. It ended up thinning out and looking like a regular mask that you would buy from the store. Still a few lumps here and there but mostly smooth once on my skin and rubbed in the circular motion. I sat and wait and let me just say - I definitely felt the &#34;pulsating&#34;. It was awesome. Then it got very uncomfortable about 5 min later. I couldn't move my mouth or face! It was actually kind of funny. I put it on my neck because with hormonal acne, I get a few breakouts under my neck and jawline. Not a very comfortable feeling and I wanted to rip it off. But beauty is pain. I recommend laying down and watching TV with it on where you don't need to move your face alot. I then removed the mask 20 minutes later in the shower with warm water and my hands. Then used a washcloth for the remains on my face. I followed with a gentle facial scrub. The results? Smooth &#34;detoxed&#34; feeling skin. I really feel like I experienced a facial. Well a &#34;cheap&#34; &#34;somewhat uncomfortable&#34; facial of course. I can't wait to see what the results are in the next couple weeks. I can honestly say that you feel instant results of freshness and smoothness on your face. Not sure about the actual removal of acne and scarring but we will see!

After a long day of work I'll come home and take a hot shower, my face is usually pretty hot and red from work, but a hot shower helps me relax a bit.   1299. When people say this stuff takes everything out of your skin, they mean it. I never realized my skin could be so tightened up. I've used other masks before but this stuff is very, very powerful. The real test is how it helps my skin during PMS when my breakouts are the worst. So far, so good! I guess you could use it every day if you wanted to - as long as you use an oil to fill in those empty pores once it's off your skin. I repeat: get an oil like jojoba (which I just learned was ho-ho-bah, not je-jo-ba.) You can use a moisturizer, but I highly recommend oil before moisturizer - just a little bit. It tricks your skin into thinking it's already produced enough oil to sooth your skin. Hence, avoiding overproduction and subsequent acne. I take away one star because of the clean up. This stuff is MUD, literally. So - you have to figure out the best plan of action in getting it off of you without putting it down the sink. DO NOT wash down the sink. Seriously. Don't. Once it dries, you can gently peel it off a little bit at a time, or scrape it off gently. I suggest putting down a newspaper or paper towels and gently peeling it off in small pieces onto that, and then rinsing off - only the residue - in the sink or shower. A good daily cleanser (acne.org has a great one), a good exfoliator in between mud applications (anything with a variety of skin acids like glycolic, lactic, citric, malic, etc - pH of 4.5-5), mud once or twice a week, and oil/moisturizer every day is working wonders for me.<br /><br />Protip 1 for those with acne: 1. apply benzoil or sacylic to pimples you feel coming (you know when they're in there!) 2. cut open a pill of acetaminophen and wet it with a little water to create an acetaminophen paste. Dab onto the unaffected (yet!) area. Continue this two step treatment process on that zit that's just waiting to erupt under the skin. It should disappear. You can definitely prevent those long-lasting zits entirely if you catch them in time, depending on how deep they are. Some pop up overnight and there is no way to zap them before they appear. Even with those, the acetaminophen will decrease redness and swelling dramatically. It's an anti-inflammatory - it works.<br /><br />Protip 2 for those with acne: use neosporin on those zits AFTER they have gone down/popped. I never thought of it, but it is reducing my scarring by at least 80% - and very, very quickly. I risked it and gave it a try wondering if it would cause more breakouts, but it has only improved my skin and become part of my regimen.how deep they are. Some pop up overnight and there is no way to zap them before they appear. Even with those, the acetaminophen will decrease redness and swelling dramatically. It's an anti-inflammatory - it works.<br /><br />Protip 2 for those with acne: use neosporin on those zits AFTER they have gone down/popped. I never thought of it, but it is reducing my scarring by at least 80% - and very, very quickly. I risked it and gave it a try wondering if it would cause more breakouts, but it has only improved my skin and become part of my regimen.

  1333. Very nice clay mask! Cant really be beat for that price. You really only need to mix about a teaspoon and a half with some apple cider vinegar or water, and that will cover your entire face. I usually mix enough for two or three applications in a Tupperware container. The left over mask does not dry out in the plastic container and is just as effective as the &#34;fresh&#34; batch.<br />I used different clay masks before ranging from very low price to very high. This one is the most effective and of best value in my opinion. I have combination/oily skin and also work as a Make Up artist. I have used this product on clients before and so far none of them reported irritations or sensitivity to the clay mask. My skin is very sensitive and I used to have problems with some mild to sometimes severe acne. I tried very expensive products to get rid of my acne, but my skin reacted very badly to salicylic acid (broke me out even more), benzoyl peroxide (very drying!) and fruit based acids (literally burned my skin off!). Those three ingredients are found in most acne treatment creams and face washes, so I had to steer clear of those. The clay mask cleans out my impurities, leaves my skin very soft and I now have skin that I am comfortable enough to walk out the door with without wearing make up (this is a big deal for anyone working with make up ;-)<br />I usually use the mask two times a week and leave it on for 10 - 30 minutes. To take it off I get a bucket of warm water and a clean wash cloth and gently wipe the mask off of my face with the damp wash cloth. You can pour the muddy water down the toilet and it won't clog your pipes .. I wouldn't recommend washing the mask off over the sink or shower drain on a regular basis, as that might clog the drain. Your skin might experience some redness, but it doesn't last long in my case or when I used it on clients. I usually wait about ten minutes before putting anything else on the face.<br /><br />My skin care routine is very low key -- I use Bioderma and Neutrogena face wipes to take off my make up (only on days that I wear make up), then I use the clarasonic mia and cetaphil daily face wash to clean my skin. Sometimes, but not every time, I will use Weleda Almond facial cream or Cetaphil daily moisturizer, but usually I just use a cotton pad and raw apple cider vinegar as a toner on my face. Especially for combination/oily skin I found the less skin care products I sue, and the less ingredients they have the better my skin looks. I do want to mention that I used and tried everything there is -- from Olay to Dior and expensive microdermabrasion treatments. I found that this mask in addition with my skin care routine works wonders and is easy on the wallet.<br /><br />This was my first time buying the clay mask on amazon, but I've been using it for two years now and never had an bad experiences with it. It also works well on dry skin to smooth out some unevenness and get all that junk out of your pores, but I would recommend using a thick moisturizer afterwards in that case.ow key -- I use Bioderma and Neutrogena face wipes to take off my make up (only on days that I wear make up), then I use the clarasonic mia and cetaphil daily face wash to clean my skin. It's not permanent and goes away during the night. It doesn't stain sheets. The labeling is a bit vague on how much you need to use to mix. My best results work with a plastic bag and 1/4cup of mix with 1/8 cup of water.
  1358. The ancient Indian seceret helps cleanse pores to the core it helps seal them up not all the way since I have big pores but it definitely helps out I love it
  1359. It's kind of a process and it's messy. It's powder, so you have to measure it out with the water to form a paste. Not my favorite mask.
  1360. I've read numerous reviews about this product and finally had to bite the bullet and buy it. Thank goodness I did. Whenever I feel a zit coming on I make a little paste out of this and put it on for about 1/2 hour. Works wonders! BTW, I use water to make it into a paste not apple cider vinegar.

I read about this stuff on Pinterest and WOW I am so impressed. It really makes your face pulse when it is on and the FIRST time I actually saw the blackhead come out of my cheek.
