  1953. When I was a teenager starting to develop oily skin and large pores on my nose an esthetician working a beauty counter at a mega store in Mexico introduced me to a green clay mask that worked wonders on my skin. When I was back in the US, however, that product was no where to be found. I've tried countless clay masks since then with only so-so results. Fast forward to today, 15 years later, I ran across this product on Amazon and bought it on a hunch. I couldn't be more pleased that I did because this is exactly like the green clay mask I used so many years ago and just from two uses it cleared up the skin problems I've been fighting with for these past 15 years. My skin is so much smoother, my pores are so clean and my skin is hardly oily at all. The only downside is that this product doesn't come ready to apply. Because it's a very fine powder it's easy to get it everywhere when trying to mix it. I highly recommend it, though. I'm very happy with the results.
  1954. I have sensitive skin and have had no problem with this mask. The jar is super full and it makes my face so clean and smooth!
  1955. Using this mask with just water or apple cider vinegar will definitely give you noticeably smoother skin for a short while but I didn't find it anything spectacular. Not one to needlessly waste anything I've purchased I decided to figure out some ways to improve this mask. I used up a whole tub of this clay trying many different ingredients and have come up with a few I am really fond of.<br /><br />LIQUID<br /><br />APPLE CIDER VINEGAR- The traditional way to use this mask. Others have extolled it virtues so I won't go into detail here, but it is a universally great choice for many skin types. ACV makes the smoothest and easiest to apply mixture as well.<br />ROSE WATER - This is currently my preferred way to use this mask. Rosewater makes your face beautifully soft and it smells divine. Even better, rose water is anti-inflammatory and full of antioxidants. It is also balancing to both dry and oily skin. If you can't find plain rosewater a rosewater and glycerin toner can be used just as well.<br />WITCH HAZEL - I use witch hazel when I'm battling breakouts. It's a mild astringent that doesn't dry out your skin like many other astringents have a tendency to do.<br /><br />ESSENTIAL OILS - I use 2 drops of each oil and generally use 1-2 oils per mask.<br /><br />TEA TREE - Perfect for those looking to use this mask as a way to control acne. A couple of drops of tea tree oil quickly stop pimples from getting any larger and helps dry them out in 1/3 of the time it usually takes.<br />NEEM - Neem oil is known to be anti-viral, anti-bacterial, and anti-inflammatory among other properties. It is wonderful for those with acne-prone skin, dry skin and conditions like eczema.<br />CHAMOMILE - This oil is anti-inflammatory and will help to reduce redness in your face. I use this when my skin is chapped from harsh winter weather.<br />LAVENDER - Soothing and softening, lavender is not just good for your skin, but a couple of drops will also mask the overwhelming scents of apple cider vinegar, tea tree and/or neem oils.<br /><br />OTHER ADDITIONS<br /><br />Activated Charcoal - Activated charcoal takes the purifying qualities of this mask and bumps it up a few dozen notches. Activated charcoal makes for an incredible mask on its own, but is quite messy and can be difficult to remove from your skin. A better way to benefit from its properties is to take a a capsule, break it open and add 1/2 to 1 capsule of charcoal into the mask. Just search for 'activated charcoal capsule' if you aren't familiar with the product.<br /><br />Oatmeal - Oatmeal is well-known for its moisturizing properties so if you have dry skin adding some oatmeal flour is a helpful addition. You can take plain (NOT flavored/sugared pouches) oatmeal and run it through your food processor until pretty fine. It doesn't need to be perfectly evenly ground. You can also add the oat flour you find in bags in the flour aisle of the grocery store.<br /><br />Honey - Excellent for moisturizing your skin as well as treating acne as honey is antibacterial. Honey is also full of antioxidants which are beneficial to your skin. Honey is also anti-inflammatory. Don't be scared, it rinses off cleanly with just warm water and leaves no sticky residue. Use raw honey for the best results.<br /><br />I hope this has helped you some!cents of apple cider vinegar, tea tree and/or neem oils.<br /><br />OTHER ADDITIONS<br /><br />Activated Charcoal - Activated charcoal takes the purifying qualities of this mask and bumps it up a few dozen notches. Activated charcoal makes for an incredible mask on its own, but is quite messy and can be difficult to remove from your skin. A better way to benefit from its properties is to take a a capsule, break it open and add 1/2 to 1 capsule of charcoal into the mask. Just search for 'activated charcoal capsule' if you aren't familiar with the product.<br /><br />Oatmeal - Oatmeal is well-known for its moisturizing properties so if you have dry skin adding some oatmeal flour is a helpful addition. You can take plain (NOT flavored/sugared pouches) oatmeal and run it through your food processor until pretty fine. It doesn't need to be perfectly evenly ground. You can also add the oat flour you find in bags in the flour aisle of the grocery store.<br /><br />Honey - Excellent for moisturizing your skin as well as treating acne as honey is antibacterial. Honey is also full of antioxidants which are beneficial to your skin. Honey is also anti-inflammatory. Don't be scared, it rinses off cleanly with just warm water and leaves no sticky residue. Use raw honey for the best results.<br /><br />I hope this has helped you some!

Unfortunately, it is a huge hassle to mix(clumps, splashes, etc), and I have tried the vinegar mix as well as the water mix with identical results; it does help with pimples and blackheads, but it is no miracle worker, and when used as instructed it dries out my skin during use to the point where it begins to burn, and leaves my face red and ultra-sensitive for the rest of the day. If I had a HUGE problem with acne, I would continue to use this product and probably get decent results, but for someone who just wants a weekly deep cleanse, I would highly suggest the Queen Helene Masque or the (more expensive but a godsend spot-treatment) Mario Badescu Drying Lotion.<br /><br />Hope this helps!

I mixed the vinegar with the clay and used it as a mask. I left it on for just over 10 mins until it mostly dried. When I washed it off I was shocked to find that my skin was extremely tight and had turned a bright red color near all the edges where I put the mask. I don't know if I was somehow allergic to a component or if my sometimes sensitive skin overreacted, or if perhaps it dried my skin out too much. I would be shocked of it were an allergy. I would also be shocked if it dried my skin out since I have truly greasy skin. I'm not sure what went wrong, but my skin did not look or feel better after using the mask. I am willing to give it a try one more time and will update my review if I see different results. I gave 2 stars because I do at least appreciate the simplicity of the product. Hopefully I have better luck next time.

  2011. It's a bit hard to mix with water into a smooth paste, so I recommend pre-mixing a batch in a cup or bowl and letting it sit overnight with saran wrap over the top of the container. After that, the texture of this mask will feel like butter! Another tip is not to leave it on your skin too long--the clay will start to PAINFULLY pull on your skin. (It really hurts, man). This mask is more drying than any clay mask I've ever used. However, I've liked it so far and it's quite a bonus that it's dirt cheap (no pun intended haha).

  2039. Tip on clean up. If you want to keep your plumbing clear and save on paper towels, put a medium to large bowl (like a large salad bowl) in your sink and fill it with warm water. Then use a wash cloth to wipe your face, and repeat using the water from the bowl until your face is cleaned. It's a quick process and the heat of the water helps easily dissolve the mask, as well as the friction from the wash cloth. The bowl catches the debris and you can just toss the used water outside. :)<br /><br />As for the efficacy of the product, I just started using it again yesterday after about a year of ... Not using it. But in the shower last night, while washing my face, I wasn't even thinking about having used the mask earlier, and noticed how smooth and clean my pores felt. It was a definite noticeable difference. Am looking forward to using more frequently.<br /><br />Also, if your skin isn't as beautifully clear as you'd ljke it to be, for me, after years of trying just about every product out there (well so it felt), hemp oil has helped me the absolute most. My skin is almost 100% clear now, and it seems to be helping with fade the hyper pigmented scars left behind. I really encourage anyone to try it. I buy mine from Amazon. I use it at night to remove my make up in the shower as a face wash, and moisturize with it after. And then I use it in the morning, just as a moisturizer with tea tree and lavender oils but I don't think they are necessary for this to help. (I don't wash my face again in the morning, I just put this on). My skin is the consistently best that it has been in a very long time, probably since using hormonal birth control (which I discontinued years ago). It's natural, moisturizing and cost-efficient. I have also started taking it internally and feel more mental clarity and more hours in the day of energy, less need for sleep. So far, I love hemp oil-- okay this turned info a hemp oil review ;) but I also am pleased with the Amazonian clay mask, and will update this review of the results continue to impress.<br /><br />Enjoy your day and think positively in the pursuit of clear skin. As funny as it sounds, I think positive thinking has also helped, and if not, it has led me to some of the most helpful skin products I've yet discover.update this review of the results continue to impress.<br /><br />Enjoy your day and think positively in the pursuit of clear skin.   2090. This stuff is great! It's Bentonite Clay for a really great price. There's a lot of it in a jar so it will last you a long time. There are recipes on the brand's website here: https://www.aztec-secret.com/pulsate.html<br /><br />Essentially, mix with equal parts liquid (water or apple cider vinegar). For best results, use raw unpastuerized apple cider vinegar (Bragg's is a popular brand). Some good recipes also use a bit of raw honey. Mix using no metal (the metal reacts with the clay and reduces effectiveness) and apply. Wash off when the mask dries out.<br /><br />This is excellent for treating acne and drawing dirt/oils out of your pores. It reduces inflammation and breakouts. However, it is VERY drying. Apply moisturizer liberally after a good cleaning. Wouldn't recommend using it more than once or twice a week.

  2138. I love how immediate the results are with this product. After my first use, I noticed the effects.<br /><br />First, it reduces the appearance and severity of existing acne. When I get a pimple, I use this product. When I take the clay mask off, the pimple is noticeably reduced in size -- and therefore much less noticeable. If the pimple is small, then when the mask comes off it might not be noticeable at all, which is great. That's a difference in less than an hour.<br /><br />Second, it reduces the size of pores. I thought they looked smaller after the first use, but it was so slight that I wasn't completely sure. I used it every other day at first, and after three uses (about a week,) it was much more noticeable that my pores were smaller.<br /><br />Third, it makes my skin look healthier. \\"Radiant\\" is the buzzword here. When I first take the mask off, my skin is initially very red. I pat my skin dry and immediately moisturize. In about 30 minutes or less, my skin looks great.<br /><br />The only downside is that it's a bit of a hassle to use. It takes preparation. It needs to be left on for a while, and I leave it on for about an hour -- although you can probably take it off after 20 minutes or so, and you can do other things in the meantime. When it dries, it might start crumbling on things. It's not easy to wash off and that takes more time. I'm not the type of person who wants to spend a lot of time on my appearance, so I don't use this nearly as much as I probably should to fully benefit from it. I've occasionally used it several days in a row, and I haven't noticed any bad effects on my skin, (quite the opposite, it's great for my skin,) so I think it's safe to use daily if you'd like to. But I don't always have the patience for or interest in it.<br /><br />I use this product by mixing it with Bragg's raw unfiltered apple cider vinegar, which I picked up at Whole Foods where I also bought this.<br /><br />My skin doesn't always respond well to products, but I've had no problems with this.   2151. After several days of scratching mosquito bites, I bought and used this product specifically to stop this aggravation. I had previously tried other natural remedies but this is the only product that helped stop the itchy feeling and heal the mosquito bites. Note: there may be other clay powders like this that may work just as well too.<br /><br />Here is how I prepared and used this product: I mixed this powdered clay with water (I didn't have the recommended apple cider vinegar on hand); I stirred it into a thin non-clumpy paste the consistency of more like almost-mayonnaise; and then I layered each bite and the surrounding red colored skin with a creamy, lotion-like thin coat. Then I left it on -- I did not wash it off. Within a couple of hours the color of each bite turned from bright red to a pink color, and the feeling of itchiness completely went away. I did feel a little bit of itchiness later on with some bites, because the paste wore off. When this happened, I went back to my already prepared lotion-like paste and coated the bites again. This stopped the feeling of itchiness once again.<br /><br />When I received a new mosquito bite -- as soon as I could -- I immediately coated it with a thin layer of this lotion paste too. This bite did feel a bit itchy, only sometimes, even with the paste on it, but instead of feeling like I needed to intensely scratch it, like I did the older bites, this one began to heal faster. This lotion paste helped heal this bite faster than the other bites because I used this product immediately on it. And as a result, I hardly felt the need to scratch it - therefore I damaged my skin less. In the other words, the toxins of the mosquito bite were neutralized by immediately using this clay, and as a result this helped heal this mosquito bite faster than the previously untreated or clayless bites.<br /><br />I also gave my reluctant spouse a thin lotion-like layer facial with this same product. The next day, he said he could still feel the positive results of having this clay sit on his oily skin for 20 minutes. He said \\"Its a plus.\\" Personally, my skin is dry and does not benefit from using this product as a facial often. However, I can imagine using this powdered clay in other ways. For instance, when my dogs get flea bites; and I even added a container of this clay and another bottle of water and a plastic stirring bowl with a lid to a medical travel kit for the car. This may come in handy for bee stings and other insect bites, and nettle stings and other similar skin irritations that can happen further away from home base - where I am keeping a supply of this clay in stock.feel the positive results of having this clay sit on his oily skin for 20 minutes. He said \\"Its a plus.\\" Personally, my skin is dry and does not benefit from using this product as a facial often. However, I can imagine using this powdered clay in other ways. This may come in handy for bee stings and other insect bites, and nettle stings and other similar skin irritations that can happen further away from home base - where I am keeping a supply of this clay in stock.
  2152. This clay makes a great mask for oily skin. And it doesn't cost an arm and a leg. I mix a tablespoon of this powdered clay with apple cider vinegar. It foams up a bit (I guess the clay is alkaline in pH.) Then I smear it on my face and let it dry. It washes off easily enough with warm water and a clean washcloth. You can even add a drop of tea tree oil (if it doesn't irritate you) for more anti-bacterial effect. You can make this up to the consistency you desire; I like it about the consistency of heavy cream, but if you like thinner or thicker, add more or less vinegar.<br /><br />It has other uses--some people make poultices out of the clay to sooth sprains or bruises. (No broken skin, please.)<br /><br />I learned how to make this as a facial from an aesthetician. This was her first step in doing a facial. Afterwards, you can put a few drops of pure lavender essential oil on a warm damp washcloth and use as a compress. This makes a quick, effective facial and is very inexpensive.

  2180. I suppose I should have researched this product a little more, but there was nothing in the description or reviews that led me to believe it would be such a hassle.<br />First off, this is a POWDER THAT MUST BE MIXED, not a ready-to-use product. I knew that from the beginning, but had no idea what a pain it would be to mix.<br />Second: The directions say, &#34;Mix Clay with equal parts of raw apple cider vinegar and/or water. Use a non-metal bowl and utensil. Stir the mixture well to a smooth paste.&#34; I realize I am no great engineer, but I'm no stranger to mixing materials (modeling clays, paints, etc.), and I have yet to get a &#34;smooth&#34; batch of this stuff mixed. It is time-consuming (another reviewer said to place the water and powder in a plastic baggie and knead it until smooth... which may work for them, but I have arthritis in my hands and they give out long before the mixture is smooth enough to be usable). Short of using a blender, I am not sure it can be mixed to a smooth, consistent, spreadable texture.<br />In the end, I didn't find it to be any better for producing &#34;tingly&#34; skin (and I certainly didn't &#34;feel [my] face pulsate!&#34; when I used it) than the clay masque products by Queen Helene or St. Ives I can buy for about the same price off the shelf at local stores.

  2191. This deep pore cleansing mask works wonders. It's very easy to use and my skin feels soft, tight, and gives me a healthy glow and my pores are smaller than ever.<br /><br />My method is very simple. I add 2-3 tbsp. full of Aztec Clay & add 2-3 tbsp of Bragg Organic Apple Cider Vinegar (also purchased from Amazon), mix together well (I purchased the Rosallini 4-In-1 bowl mixing tool set from Amazon/plastic) and apply to your face generously, wait 10-15 minutes, wash off and reap the benefits.<br /><br />PRO TIP: I have a couple tips to share. DO NOT wash off this mask in your sink, you will clog your drain. I put a plastic bag in my sink when I use this mask. I open the bag up wide and I lightly scrape off what I can, most of it cracks and falls off into the bag, what doesn't I lightly scrape off with the handle of one of my paint brush tools that comes with the 4-In-1 tool set. After most of it has come off my face I take my Olay cleansing brush, add a small amount of water, and slowly remove the rest of the mask, then I wrap up the plastic bag, throw it away and nothing has clogged my drain. I then rinse my face with warm water just to remove any residue that was left behind.<br /><br />My skin looks radiant and healthy, what more could a girl ask for? I give this product 5 Stars & I recommend you try it, you won't be sorry!

  2232. So I read all these glowing reviews, but I was still skeptical. I bought some regular apple cider vinegar at the store, when home and mixed it all up. It does froth, but it makes a nice smooth mask. I put it on, and waited 27 minutes before I washed it off. It was SUPER itchy on me, and I wore it as long as I could stand it.<br /><br />My skin type is pretty dry - if I don't use enough moisturizer it gets oily in efforts to make up for the lack of moisture - The older I get, I have uneven tone from sun damage and I get small breakouts with the weather changing, or before my period. But my biggest irk with my skin is having blackheads. I have never found a product that could remove them, and I have tried everything. My sister owned a skin spa for a long time, and she has given me tons of high end products, but none of them has ever worked very well.<br />The only thing that ever worked was having a $400 acid peel treatment - which I obviously couldn't ever have afforded without it being a family discount thing.<br />(Since then, my sister has moved to another state and given up the spa, (not a very good business in a bad economy) so no more free or discounted stuff for me :&lt; Sad.)<br /><br />But THIS worked!<br /><br />It seriously took away nearly ALL my blackheads!!! I'm so impressed with it! I still have a few blackheads here and there, but my skin looks clearer and smoother than I ever seen it. I think with another few treatments I'll probably see even better results.<br /><br />The clay is pretty drying - and it was uncomfortably itchy, and left my skin splotchy and red, but that faded after a half hour or so. I think it was probably just the acidic vinegar that made it itch.<br /><br />But keep in mind girls (and gents) itching or burning doesnt mean it is bad for you. Quite the reverse. The acid peel felt the same way: it just means its removing a layer or two of your skin. Microdermabrasion does the same.<br /><br />Since it kind of feels the same as an acid peel, I'd definitely have a good soothing moisturizer with high SPF on hand - like 50 or 55 - before going outside.<br /><br />SO YES! I heard that using ACV removes the itching factor. I can not vouch for that.<br /><br />I would save water is left in the baggie for another time. THIS IS CLAY, IT WILL CLOG YOUR DRAIN!!   2238.   2239. Follow the directions. Mix 50/50 with apple cider vinegar and pack it on your face or wherever 1/4&#34; to 1/2&#34; thick. Wait 20 minutes. I always wash things like masks or scrubs off my face in the shower instead of over the sink, so that I don't have to worry about clean up later. The mask dried, and I could feel it pulling at my face which is a good sign. I looked in the mirror and saw the clay cracked, so I washed it off. I'm a chronic pimple picker, so I got up close and personal with a mirror and examined nearly every pore I could find. Doing this, I gently massaged my face, and magically black heads and white heads that I had not previously seen (prior to putting the mask on) were starting to surface. Being the picker that I am, I coaxed the heads out and lightly swabbed with some alcohol on those places. I followed with moisturizer. The next day, more white heads started to surface around my jawline. So in essence, this is not some magical zit-b-gone product, but with a few uses, your face will naturally start to clear because it acts like a magnet and causes the gunk to surface slowly over time. It pulls the impurities out that lurk deep within your epidermis. It feels good to know that you are getting a good deep clean with this product. I like it, and I will continue to use it. Also, my friend told me about bentonite clay. She paid something like $25 for this exact same thing except hers came from some boutique, so yeah. This product is no frills, but is worth every penny. It is low cost because no celebrity has claimed it and put their name on it and charged you an outrageous price for what is essentially dirt.
  2240. This stuff makes my skin feel wonderful and helps clear out my pores. Be sure you mix the clay with apple cider vinegar instead of water to prevent clumping. It will leave your skin really red but it goes away after about 1 hour or less.
  2241. So I think I actually like the Redmond Clay better, but I ran out of my tube of it, and had this still kicking around. I learned a cool rehydration method for this and the Redmond Clay though. I didn't have Braggs on hand, and whenever I mix it with water it just clumps, but the Redmond Clay was so silky smooth, so I investigated.<br /><br />Anyway, for 1/2 a cup of this clay, you use 2 cups of water. For a cup, you use 4 cups of water. Just put the clay in a quart size jar, add 2 cups water, shake it, and wait 24-48 hours, and it will be the consistency of a thick pudding. Shake it every once in awhile so the water and clay redistribute and it wont clump. It stays good as long as it's in a air safe tight container. Easy peasy.<br /><br />Both clays will suck absolutely anything out of your pores. And I mean it. Blackheads on your nose? Forget it. Also good for sinus infections. I wash my face with this daily, it's the only thing that actually gets everything off and out of your skin. And by wash I mean I wear a mask for 10-15 minutes and then rinse it off. Works wonders.

  2269. I first picked up this clay at a natural market on a whim and it has been my best friend for years. I've tried other premixed masks but I always go back to making my own.<br /><br />Edit [Nov 11, 2013]:<br />I have recently read about the pH of betonite clay being about 8 or 9 (above 7 is basic). Apparently if you simply use water, the pH remains the same. Since Apple Cider Vinegar is acid (pH around 4), it balances out and is good for the skin. Plain vinegar is more acidic, so yo would end up with a slightly more acidic mixture. Ideal pH of the skin is 5.5. These are things to keep in mind when you are mixing up your mask. If you want to be more precise and match the ideal pH of the skin, you could always use pH strips to test your mixture.

  2297. I've used this clay mask twice so far and my skin has never been more clear! I have switched up my skin care routine all together so I don't know how much I can contribute to this product, but it really seems to do what it says it will! I don't have chronic acne, but I always have a few spots of pimples, especially on my chin and forehead. Since using this mask those have diminished significantly! I purchased this initially because I suddenly sprouted terrible acne on my chest, shoulders, and back. This was surprising to me at 24 but I think it was stress related. I mixed up a bunch of the clay with both ACV and water and slapped it all over. After the first use I noticed a huge difference! The acne isn't gone, but it has cleared up amazingly. I'm hoping with a few more uses it will leave my skin nice a clear. So far I use it once a week.<br /><br />It is a bit of a messy process to mix up the clay and apply it all over your chest, shoulders, back, and face but I'll go through how I've been doing it. I read some reviews suggesting mixing it in a sandwich bag, that would definitely cut down on the mess but it seems too wasteful for me.<br />I just mix up 1 part clay powder, 1 part ACV, and add water as needed to reach the desired consistency (make sure to not use anything metal as it will react with the chemical properties of the clay mixture)<br />Then I spread that s*** all over where needed. First I apply to my chest, shoulders, and back. I'll leave that on for about 20 minutes, then I apply the rest to my face. Once I start feeling the mask pulsate (it really does make my face feel like it's pulsating) I hop in the shower and let the warm water take the mask off for me. This is the really messy part if you are applying to more than just your face as it will leave behind lots of clay.<br />To avoid clogging my drain I don't force any of the pieces down. Most of it will break up into small particles again and go down the drain, whatever is left I use a paper towel to clean my tub. I leave the hot water running for a little while for good measure.<br />Lastly, once the clay mix is completely dry in the bowl I used to whip it up, it's easy to wipe the excess into the garbage.<br />This sounds like a lot of work but it is actually a lot of fun to me. Using ACV makes the mask I nice muddy consistency that is fun to spread everywhere and watch turn into a dark earthy color.<br /><br />To end this exceedingly long review, if you use this product, pay attention to your skin, not recommended times. Once the mask starts pulsating and feeling uncomfortable TAKE IT OFF. Whether it's 5 minutes in or 25 minutes in, pay attention to your own body! I have sensitive skin and once the mask starts feeling uncomfortable I take it off! As other reviewers have said, it does leave your skin really red after, I think it's just because the mask pulls and tightens as it dries. Other reviewers have said to use an oil free moisturizer after, I'm not sure why it has to be oil free, but I listened to them and have been very happy with the results.eave the hot water running for a little while for good measure. Lastly, once the clay mix is completely dry in the bowl I used to whip it up, it's easy to wipe the excess into the garbage. This sounds like a lot of work but it is actually a lot of fun to me. Using ACV makes the mask I nice muddy consistency that is fun to spread everywhere and watch turn into a dark earthy color. To end this exceedingly long review, if you use this product, pay attention to your skin, not recommended times. Once the mask starts pulsating and feeling uncomfortable TAKE IT OFF. Whether it's 5 minutes in or 25 minutes in, pay attention to your own body! I have sensitive skin and once the mask starts feeling uncomfortable I take it off! As other reviewers have said, it does leave your skin really red after, I think it's just because the mask pulls and tightens as it dries. Other reviewers have said to use an oil free moisturizer after, I'm not sure why it has to be oil free, but I listened to them and have been very happy with the results.
  2298. I've used this product once and it worked well!! The clay made my hair very soft. My curls were elongated and defined. I look forward to using it again!!! I love it!!!
  2299. I first bought this at whole foods about a year ago and fell in love with it. Getting it on Amazon is even better!! It seriously helps with acne, and I have terribly sensitive skin too. I always break out when I'm stressed, and this stuff is a miracle in a jar! Mixed with vinegar, it is the best face mask I've ever used.
  2300. My daughter loves this stuff. She uses it 2-3 times a week and she swears it gets rid of blackheads better than anything else! Makes her skin smooth and soft with no flakies!
  2301. This stuff is AWESOME. Do not let these details deter you in any way from buying this. Stock up. I looked into this clay because I was looking into other Ayurveda treatments for other things. I got this because i am sick of dealing with clogged pores. Sick of trying things, the prices, claims, etc. (I don't have any real long term issues other than this plus your normal issues that crop up, so not sure how it would work on actual cystic or red acne blemishes). I am in my late 30s/early 40s? ;) Lying about my age? Doing a little Botox? Yes - but just some background so you know who is doing this review. First, you seriously may want to consider doing this before you take a shower - I'll tell you why later in the review. I did not know this, but the clay is powder, as in baby powder-type consistency, so be careful when you open it (I thought it might be more solid like other clay masques I have used, as in already damp in the jar). This is then mixed with equal parts of organic raw apple cider vinegar (see Braggs - I purchased this from Amazon as well). I know, it sounds weird and unpasturized and will it go bad, but no, you are fine. Does not need to be refrigerated. It's best to use a glass bowl, and if you have ever had your hair colored, the application brush is a perfect mixer. This is mixed until you form a paste, I would say in between mayo and toothpaste. It smells like vinegar. It is very messy. It is green. The jar talks about lathering on 1/4&#34; - 1/2&#34; - just at 1/4&#34; is a lot of masque! I then slather it on to try and get to 1/4&#34;. :) It does not fall off. After doing this, I wondered how/if it would ever dry because it was so thick and wet, but it does. As it dries, you feel like your face in hardening and being pulled in, and it really IS hardening (and at this point it is SORT of uncomfortable but nothing bad at all). ;) Let it stay on until it dries/mostly dries (and at that point you really want it off). Now here's the shower part - if you try to wash this off in the sink like any other masque - be aware it does not just rinse right off. You are trying to re-wet and moisten back up this clay - not easy. Well, of course it will come off, but make sure your face is down into the bowl, and you will need a washcloth to gently get it off. I think you could also use a netting bath puff. Once it is off, rinse, rinse, rinse. You will smell a little bit like vinegar for a while (or at least I think so, and I think maybe this is just a teeny bit of residual masque in my hairline?). Your face will be somewhat red for a little while (and the jar tells you this). It is nothing bad; it just looks like you got a little sun, no big deal. I saw a difference after using this one time. I used it twice in one week, and I had different skin. I am serious. I don't work for this company and I have done lots of reviews, been on Amazon for years. I tried this a number of times before posting this review, and my opinion is the same. I love it, it works, I wish I had known about this product before. I am not using anything different. I do use an exfoliating skin cleaner/wash, but I have always done this. This is the first thing that made a very obvious and very significant difference after the first use; I wasn't waiting for weeks to see any improvement or forced to use an entire skin care line and not mix product to see a difference after weeks of use. I am hooked, and I hope it works for you if you decide to try it.re's the shower part - if you try to wash this off in the sink like any other masque - be aware it does not just rinse right off. You are trying to re-wet and moisten back up this clay - not easy. Well, of course it will come off, but make sure your face is down into the bowl, and you will need a washcloth to gently get it off. I put a rather thick layer on and it did not take that long to dry. The sensation when it was drying was really neat haha. It feels like your skin is being pulled tight, and you cannot smile or move your face. It feels really good though!!! It does slightly tingle and it feels as if its doing .. something! When I was ready to remove the product I put a very hot cloth over my face to soften up the clay. I then used paper towels, which I threw in the trash, to remove the excess clay. Afterward, my face was slightly red but my pores instantly felt smaller and my skin looked VERY VERY CLEAR!!!! After using this a few times now, my overall skin tone has improved and my face feels more supple and firm. It has not improved the fine lines I have around my eyes, but it has definitely reduced the pore size and seems to have started some collagen production. Will definitely buy again!

  2312. I absolutely love this product! I can't believe I didn't think of buying this before as I have seen the effects of these kinds of clays first-hand before. When I was younger I took a river tour somewhere in Mexico, and part of it was getting a clay treatment from the clay in the river, which is said to have all sorts of beautifying and healing properties. This product is almost indistinguishably similar.<br />I usually apply it with regular apple cider vinegar (because the other kind is honestly a bit more than I am willing to spend) one to three times per week and have had excellent results. It appears to dry out those pesky problem pimples as well as soothe erupting pimples and cystic acne (though to a slightly lesser degree). Recently I also learned that you can also mix tea tree oil (though I usually leave out the apple cider vinegar when I do this and just use water) into it to help treat acne and it has worked wonders. I also sometimes apply it problem areas on my body (upper arms, chest, back) and it works for those areas as well with equal success.<br />Do be prepared for the pulling sensation because you can definitely feel it and it will probably start to hurt after a bit if you leave the mask on too long (which I have done and regretted). Also, be prepared for your skin to break out a little bit when you first start using it. This clay works by pulling impurities up to the surface, so if you have a lot of them which you have not been pulling up to the surface routinely, then they will start to be pulled up. However, as you keep using it this will lessen. Also, be cautious of the drying effects of the clay. It can be very, very drying, especially if, like myself, you are also applying topical acne medications like clindamycin and retinoid cream at the same time. I definitely recommend applying an oil-free acne moisturizer after washing off the mask and not following washing off the mask with washing with any strong acne cleanser (clearisil, proactiv, etc.) as this will only aggravate the skin/increase dryness. While I am on this topic, I recommend making sure that the skin is clean of all makeup/creams/body lotions etc. before applying the clay as these things will either decrease its effectiveness or possibly cause irritation of the skin.) as this will only aggravate the skin/increase dryness. While I am on this topic, I recommend making sure that the skin is clean of all makeup/creams/body lotions etc. before applying the clay as these things will either decrease its effectiveness or possibly cause irritation of the skin.

(I also have had eczema like skin occasionally on my legs and arms, so I have pretty sensitive skin.) I took my makeup off and mixed about 2-3 tsp of Apple Cider Vinegar and 2-3 tsp of the powder and mixed it just in a Tupperware cup and evenly spread it on my face with my finger. I waited about 20-30 minutes (until it was dry) and I just washed it off right away in the shower so it, hopefully, wouldn't clog the drain. But if you're doing this over the sink I recommend not washing it down the drain, as some have said in other reviews. (I didn't use any face wash that day or night) After I got out and put some face moisturizer on, my face felt SUPER clean and soft! This morning when I woke up, my acne scars had faded enough so I just used BB cream and some concealer on my face. Really excited to use this again! So if you're debating whether to get this or not, I HIGHLY recommend this! But be patient with it to fade scars and clear your skin, this was just after one use and I plan to use it once a week.   2355. I think this clay powder makes a nice face mask couple times a week when you want to pamper yourself. I don't believe all hype with reduce pore sizes and completely free to acne, etc.<br /><br />I find it to do the following<br />- Tighten skin temporarily. If used religiously, you might be seeing smaller pores, but after a while of not using it, pore size will turn back to how it was<br />- Calming skin. I feel the acne areas are less red the morning after I use the clay. However I would like to point out I always use benyozl peroxide 2.5% at night as acne treatment. I did not rely on this product alone to treat acne.<br />- Less Oily. I find my face produce slightly less sebum throughout the day on the day after I use this clay. By that I mean I blot at noon instead of 10:30AM.<br />- Make up stays better. This could be result of face being less oily.<br /><br />Also, I want to provide my little experience in working with this product as first few times I had some issues and could not find help online.<br />1. Recommending tools? bowl, I use a ceramic ramekin I keep in the bathroom just for masks and stuff; a plastic spoon to scoop the clay powder (I break the handle so it's short enough to keep inside the jar), a plastic fork for mixing (find heavier duty forks), lastly, ELF $1 foundation brush (its complete plastic bristles makes it a good clay applying tool, easy to clean up too!)<br />2. How much water should I use? I recommend starting out with the same amount of liquid you think you will need as masks. If you need 5 tablespoons of clay? put 5 tbp of liquid in the bowl. In this case you will not waste product or end up making another batch because you didn't make enough. I use about 2 tbp because I lay my mask as thick as possible.<br />3. Mask too clumpy? Again, start with water, then add one spoon of product at a time. 2 tbp water requires about 2~3 rounded spoonfuls of clay powder. Use the fork to mix the product well before adding the next spoon will ensure you get a smooth texture!!<br />4. Face turning red because the clay bits are so hard to take off? First of all, avoid hairlines, it will make cleaning process a lot easier. Second, I recommend using thick layer of clay mask, and wash it before it completely dries. Feel free to enjoy the paluse feeling as long as the clay surface is still dark green and in chunky pieces. when clay mask breaks into small bits then you will definitely have problem taking it off. Excessive rubbing will make your face red. That happens to every product.<br /><br />Hope these information will help you guys making the most of this product (though it looks like 1lb will last me years...)n will ensure you get a smooth texture!!<br />4. Face turning red because the clay bits are so hard to take off? First of all, avoid hairlines, it will make cleaning process a lot easier. Second, I recommend using thick layer of clay mask, and wash it before it completely dries. Feel free to enjoy the paluse feeling as long as the clay surface is still dark green and in chunky pieces. when clay mask breaks into small bits then you will definitely have problem taking it off. Excessive rubbing will make your face red. That happens to every product.<br /><br />Hope these information will help you guys making the most of this product (though it looks like 1lb will last me years...)

  2364. Ok - I rarely ever write a review but I gotta tell you guys - this stuff is amazing. I have had bad skin all my life. I mean, like - 30 years old and still using over the counter acne products - been on meds for acne- changed my diet - done it all. We're talking - concealer all day long to hide the hyper-pigmentation, acne, black heads, scarring. Its a mess. I hated my face - I hated showing it to the world. Anyway, I went to get a facial a few months ago and my esthetician told me about this clay. She had perfect skin and was 27 and told me she'd had terrible skin all her life and this clay did the trick. I was skeptical I'll be honest, but I bought it ( who can say no at this price) and tried it and HOLY MACKERAL - this stuff.. its like from some alien world.<br /><br />First of all - mix it with apple cider vinegar NOT WATER. ACV is SO good for your skin and it just helps heal it so much better than water. Its gonna smell strange if you arent used to ACV but thats ok :) It also mixes better than water does with the clay. Do not use anything metal with this clay - I use a wooden bowl.<br /><br />This stuff is going to make you feel like your face is in a vacuume - it hardens to a rock-hard shell on your face and your face will pulsate like it has a heart beat. Let it be known that its not a comfortable feeling, and it freaked me out at first, but you get used to it - and start to even like it ( weird I know ).<br /><br />Ok now for results. The first time I did the mask, I didnt notice very much of a difference, except that my skin was bright bright red for an hour. However, after using it 3 times a week for about a month, i'm noticing a HUGE difference. Its occurred to me now that it was working all the time, and It just took cumulative progress for me to finally really notice.<br /><br />When i use the mask now, my face afterwards look younger every time. My skin plumps and is so supple, and if i have acne in a certain spot - it will be reduced to almost nothing. Hyper pigmentation always looks so much better - sometimes the marks are completely gone. My make up slides on smoother, and i've been using way less concealer than I used to. My scarring seems to even be fading. Its kind of miraculous.<br /><br />I plan to keep using this mask and have begun using it on other parts of my body that also have acne. Point blank, this is an inexpensive way to heal your skin!!! I am so glad I found it, and I can't wait to go back to my esthetician and show her my results. That is If i even need her to do a facial! :). And I'll use it multiple times too which expedites the pimple process even faster. Pimples have cores and if you don't get rid of that core, it's just going to keep growing and spilling out ooze. I have some of this mask on my chin right now bc my face decided to erupt like 3 zits in one spot. Those are the really bigs ones I use this mask for. After one use I was able to squeeze out the pus and it went down to 1/3 its size. I use it again to help drain out whatever is left (since it pretty much always opens up the pimple after taking the mask off)and then if it's still a little puffy or I just want it to scab over and heal even faster, I'll use the mixture one more time.<br /><br />So if you're acne prone like me and you want to speed up the pimple process, I say go for it. But don't use it where you don't need it. I don't think of it as a mask to make your face smoother and vibrant but as a pimple killer! I'm sure the apple vinegar is totally an acting agent with helping but out of every mask and acne product I have ever used, this is the only thing that has ever shown the fastest results and gotten rid of those mountainous zits in a speedier manner.t's still a little puffy or I just want it to scab over and heal even faster, I'll use the mixture one more time.<br /><br />So if you're acne prone like me and you want to speed up the pimple process, I say go for it.   2424. My skin has never been so soft and blemish-free. I was a little alarmed to read on the label, not just once but twice, in bold uppercase red font, that you will FEEL YOUR FACE PULSATE but am glad I didn't chicken out! My skin is a bit sensitive, so I only leave it on for about 5-7 minutes, basically until it dries and starts to get a tight, itchy feeling. (aka pulsate?) It is kind of a weird, uncomfortable sensation, but it's not too bad and the results are well worth the 30 seconds of discomfort while I remove it.<br /><br />A tiny bit goes a long way, so it is also a great bargain. I put about a tablespoon of it into a plastic baggie, add water, and squish the bag until the mud is a smooth consistency. Using a plastic bag makes it easier to mix than using a spoon, and is also a lot less cleanup. Next I scoop it out with a plastic spoon, and apply to my face and neck. When I start to get the telltale &#34;pulsating&#34; sensation, I wipe it off with a few damp paper towels and put them in the trash can. This minimizes the amount that goes down the drain when do a final rinse with water. Then I apply moisturizer and put the leftover mud in the baggie the refrigerator for another use. I usually do it twice a week.<br /><br />I highly recommend giving this a try if you are prone to breakouts, as I am.

  2527. One of the best purchases I have made to help with my problematic breakouts each month! I purchase off of Amazon just about weekly for everyday deals and also the hard to find items that your local CVS or Walgreens might not cover. I appreciate when people write thorough and well thought out reviews that help others, so I will try to do that as well with this one. First, the amount of clay for the price is outstanding. I could get well over 2-3 months use from one tub. I have problematic frequent breakouts 'that time' of the month and they range from just under the skin irritating pimples to full blown cystic nightmares. This clay, when combined with Apple Cider Vinegar (like suggested instead of water) works miracles on drying up and TRULY shrinking my pores. Make the mixture to a mid-thick paste, swipe it on, (I use a designated makeup fan brush) let semi-dry then add one more layer. 20 min set time and I can practically peel off the dried clay with my fingers and I have butter smooth oil-free skin underneath after a quick warm water rinse. For a price you can't beat and frequent use its grand for us oil producing madhouses. It also works great for the quick redness/acne overnight spot treatment when you see one popping up.
  2528. I haven't been using this clay long, but it's working wonders. I'm in my late 20s and I have mild acne, especially on my cheeks and forehead. The first time I used it, I mixed it with a generic brand of apple cider vinegar, and my face got really red and itchy after I rinsed the clay off. I almost didn't try it again, but I decided to buy raw ACV (Bragg Brand--Amazon also sells it) and try again. I mixed 1 TBS clay with 1 TBS ACV, and that was just enough for my mask. It worked really well! My skin looked a little clearer after the first (successful) application. I've been using it every other day since and my skin has been improving. I would recommend rinsing it off in the shower, because it clogged my sink drain. After I rinse off the mask, I apply a little bit of Argan oil, which also seems to be helping my acne.<br /><br />Despite the bumpy start, I love this clay for my masks. If you didn't have luck with this clay, I would suggest changing the liquid you used to mix it. :)
  2529. Finally a solution to my acne. My face seriously has never looked better. Definitely recommend using it with a good quality apple cider vinegar.

  2534. With so many great reviews on this product, I decided to give it a try. My husband would kill me if he knew I was outing him, but I've gotten him using it as well. Mixing with apple cider as suggested is like a science experiment, making it more &#34;guy-friendly&#34; to my husband. I've been mixing this in a paper bowl so I can throw the remaining mix in the trash. Once mixed, it's very thick. If I emptied the remainder down the sink, my husband's agreeable attitude to using this would go down the sink as well…once he unclogged the sink pipes. I'm pretty sure you could mold a pottery bowl out of this stuff if you wanted. The smell isn't the greatest, but tolerable. Once this dries, avoid any facial expressions because it will crack off in big chunks. Not the easiest to wash off, but my skin feels great after I use it.

I look forward to experimenting with the formula (recommended use: one part clay powder, one part apple cider vinegar).   2551. This clay will transform your skin. I saw a noticeable difference after using it only two times. My pores are looking smaller, blackheads are disappearing, and acne is clearing up. And it doesn't dry out the skin. Highly recommend this product.
  2552. I love this mask. I use it about once a week. My tips: Throw the package directions out the window. Equal parts clay and ACV is a good starting point, but don't be afraid to experiment with ratio to get a nice mousse-y consistency, and you really don't need more than a teaspoon of clay (a far cry from the Tbs recommended on the tub). And putting it on to a thickness of 1/2 inch? Forget about it. Aside from being wasteful, I doubt it would even be possible to layer it on that thick. Also, the thicker it is, the longer it takes to dry (and if you're waiting too long for it to dry, you might leave it on your face too long and cause irritation) and the harder it is to remove. Thin layer, leave on your face 20-30 minutes max, and hop in the shower to rinse off because it does not wipe away easily like prepackaged masks from the drugstore. Your face will be a nice shade of red everywhere that the mask was applied, but don't worry, that's normal and it fades. Just don't do it before a first date and you'll be fine.
  2553. I was surprised it came fast in the mail. I was excited to use it, but a little nervous. Even w/ my first time using it. I was surprised, it did dry up fast. As suspected, but once I rinsed it off I could tell it was lifting and opening up my pores. My blackheads were almost (not completely) gone. My skin was soft too. Next time I will let sit longer for better results. My brother wanted to use the mask too, so far we both like it.

  2590. I've had terrible acne prone skin since I was nine. I've tried EVERYTHING. Every kit, cleanser, toner, lotion, mask, potion, or whatever.. So I ordered it Sunday and it arrived Friday morning. I just got home and was so excited to find the package. First thing I should say to anyone wanting to buy this product- OPEN IT OVER THE SINK! I did not realise it was a powder and in my excitement opened it sitting on my bed...oops but no biggie there is so much in a container I doubt I'll run out any time soon. Next advice LESS IS MORE- when it comes to mixing it. I grabbed a Tupperware bowl and poured quite a large amount of the clay into it which when mixed with the apple cider vinegar ended up making a huge batch. Oh well. One thing I've got to say though is that the packaging DOES NOT lie- it says your face will \\"pulsate\\" and it will! Its not uncomfortable though so don't be scared. Now I have extremely oily skin so I used a thick layer like the container says but I can definitely see people with sensitive skin wanting to use a little less. I left it on for twenty minutes then rinsed with WARM water, and I've got to tell you while I was rinsing it off I could already feel a huge difference! My skin feels so soft I'm almost to tears..my skin has never felt this amazing and if you've gone through life wishing for beautiful skin you will understand why such a strong reaction to such a little thing.   2600. I absolutely love this stuff. I was pretty skeptical of all the praising reviews but I was wrong! It works super great. I've done a couple different application methods. First I tried the plastic baggy, and putting some clay in and I actually use a little more apple cider vinegar than clay. This way you can make it into more of a smooth paste then a chunky mess. Then I put it on with an old flat foundation brush. Works like a charm. I don't have a hard time taking it off at all. I just use a paper towel and wet it, then let it soak on my face and get the mask wet. Then I wipe it off, with another wet papertowel, works like a charm. I've also mixed the mask in an old protein scoop, which works pretty well too. It's easiest just to play with it till you find what works. The pulsating sensation is pretty weird, but enjoyable in a weird way. I love this mask.

  2630. It's really just a nice clay mask. I felt the tingling, pulsing sensation that others claimed. My face really wasn't red afterwards. It is a bit messy to mix, and I found the Ziploc bag method to be the best as it allows you to mash the mixture to avoid chunks. Be prepared to mix it for a few minutes. I spread a very thin layer on, just enough to work, not thick enough to crack and fall off. It really doesn't take a thick layer. Next time, I think I'll make it thinner and just brush it on. My skin was noticeably softer and pores were visibly smaller for about 2 days afterwards. I have mild to moderate acne and combination skin, but I can't really call this stuff a miracle. It was just as effective on my acne spots as any other mask I've used. What I really noticed was how firm and soft my late-30s skin felt.<br /><br />Pros: Simple, natural clay mask, great for weekly or twice weekly use. Noticeable improvement in skin tone and reduced pores for about 48 hours after use.<br /><br />Cons: Messy. Be prepared with moist towels handy for clean-up, watch out for your plumbing, and have something to store leftovers because You'll never make exactly the right amount.

  2645. This stuff is amazing. I had no idea it existed until my roommate showed it to me and swore by it. I immediately purchased it on Amazon, and started whipping up a face mask as soon as I opened the box.<br /><br />A few tips:<br /><br />This stuff can be MESSY. I started out using a regular kitchen bowl and spoon when mixing it, but was having a lot of trouble getting a good consistency and I read you are not supposed to use metal utensils with it. I then switched to using a regular bowl and a plastic spoon to mix, followed by using a powder makeup brush to apply all over my face in layers. What a difference the brush makes!<br /><br />You can also use apple cider vinegar to mix it with, which I have tried and had no problems with. And you can use rosewater that you can purchase on Amazon, and I've heard that it works even better with that.<br /><br />I leave it on until it has completely dried, which makes your face stuck. And I mean STUCK, once this dries you need to go ahead and wash it off because any movements you make may possibly hurt (especially if you laugh). It washes off easily though, and you can see how clean your face looks once you rinse it off.<br /><br />I have used this when I see myself starting to get a few breakouts when I'm under a lot of stress, and nothing have cleared those up as fast as this product.   2650. (Product reviewer: Female, 22 years old, long-term moderate acne)<br /><br />I had high expectations for this product after seeing the excellent reviews. However, after using it a few times, I have seen no real improvement in my skin.<br /><br />A few tips:<br /><br />-A little bit of this stuff goes a LONG way. Start with a small amount when mixing for the first time; you can always add more.<br />-Be warned that your face may be red after using this product (similar to getting your eyebrows waxed). Don't use it right before going out. To avoid some of this irritation, when you go to take the mask off, try using a warm washcloth and pressing it to your face to soften the clay. As tempting as it may be to start rubbing it off (especially if it is itchy/stinging), that seemed like it would irritate my skin more.<br />-It's messy. Get a plastic container to mix the clay in another one to rinse your washcloth in when you wash your face. I had a hard time keeping it out of my hair -- another reason to avoid using this mask before going out.<br /><br />Best of luck to the rest of you; I was just disappointed this product didn't work for me.

  2657. I seriously cannot say enough good things about this face mask. After reviewing the reviews I was still a little hesitant to try this... I mean after all there is no such things as a miracle mask, right? WRONG. This product is a miracle! My skin goes through stages where I will break out in different places... They were brought to that whitish pus point too so I safely popped them as well. In 2 nights I tried again. This time I took the mask off in the shower and it wasn't so uncomfortable.... Same thing my face turned red and I did the rest of my fave care and went to bed. the next night I did it again and when I woke up the next day that's when I realized the difference. My pores were so tiny and basically disappearing... There were barely anymore bumps on my chin the only marks on my face were my acne scars. I used this once more tonight (2 days later) and I am happy to admit I HAVE NOT ONE PIMPLE OR CYST ANYWHERE on my face. This time the redness only lasted about 10 minutes so I could examine my skin better. Not only did this fix my acne but my forehead wrinkles are filling in as well. My skin is so soft and my pores are so tiny that I can barely see them! (I had huge pores before)<br />I recommend this product to EVERYONE. It's a fast solution.   2689. I just tried this product last night for the first time and it was much better than I expected. I mixed mine with raw apple cider vinegar instead of water and applied to my face and neck. My nose of course was the first to dry so you could feel the tingling/mild burning sensation. It wasn't unbearable or anything but you might want to be careful if you have sensitive skin. There was a point where I could actually feel my heartbeat throbbing in my face! LOL! Anyway, my neck area never did completely dry but I finally washed everything off in the tub when it seemed all the parts were beginning to crack (so I assumed it was \\"dry enough\\"). I splashed my face and neck thoroughly with warm water (without rubbing the skin) until all the clay melted away, then I patted dry with a soft towel. When I looked in the mirror, there was no redness whatsoever (like I thought there would be) and the huge pores I have around my nose area were actually diminished considerably! My skin felt a little tight so I followed the treatment with a full facial steam for 20 minutes and then applied a little chilled aloe vera gel before going to bed. This morning when I woke up, my pores were still tiny and even with the gel on my face, my skin didn't feel oily like it usually does when I wake up. I love this stuff!!!<br /><br />Word of warning though, I used this in the bathtub (not in the shower) and wiped up the clay residue left behind after the water drained with paper towels. It *is* clay afterall and I don't want to find out what it'll do if too much of it gets caught up in my pipes.<br /><br />Update (5/20/2013): I've found that applying the mud with a paintbrush to my face and neck makes the thickness more uniform all over (so some parts don't dry while other parts still stay wet). I also sat facing a box fan for a little while and both my face and neck dried uniformly. Finally, I heated a hand towel with tap water and just pressed it to my face for a few seconds (like they do in a spa) and as the mud melted, I just wiped it away and wrung out my towel in a plastic tub. I repeated and just threw the muddy water outdoors over my compost when I finished (so no danger of clogging up my pipes)! I repeated and just threw the muddy water outdoors over my compost when I finished (so no danger of clogging up my pipes)! Yay!

Unfortunately, it's easy to fall in the trap of buying product(s) that are just horrible for your skin.<br /><br />I received the healing clay and braggs apple cider vinegar a few days ago and I can already see a healthy difference in my skin (face). Because my skin tends to be more on the sensitive side, I didn't want to take any risk leaving in on for too long. So i suggest you consider that before you time it. I've left it on for 15 min. And yes, your face will get a bit red, but it lasts for about 10 min for me then back to normal. So far, this stuff works and leaves my face feeling clean and refreshed. Just remember, everything in moderation. There are no quick fixes, it's a process so be patient. But this product certainly lives up to the hype!<br /><br />I would give it 5 stars, but i'd like to wait and see if it continues to work effectively. If it does so, i will gladly come back and give it the rating it deserves :)

  2719. Just awesome.<br />Got everyone in my family hooked. Cleared up a nasty case of peri-oral dermatitis/acne I had. Keeps acne at bay with regular use. I use about every other day on average.<br />I mix with straight Bragg's ACV (with the mother!), and I prefer a slightly thinner consistency. This product has changed my skin forever.<br />You will need a good moisturizer, as this will suck all of the crud out of your pores but you can expect to sacrifice some moisture in the process.<br />I've never used a product that did more for my skin than this.<br />Instructions on the package suggest a 1 to 1 ratio of clay to ACV- I find that a 1 to 1.5 ratio makes a consistency I'm happier with. The instructions also say to apply this mask 1/4 inch thick- Whaaat?! No, you don't need to do that... you only need enough to cover your skin, no super thick layers necessary. The label says the tub contains enough clay for 10-15 masks... I find that mixing the clay to ACV at a 1 to 1.5 ratio (I use about a teaspoon of clay to 1.5 teaspoons ACV) and applying a much thinner layer than the product label suggests still provides REMARKABLE results while stretching the product much farther. This 1 pound tub lasts me about 4-5 months, and I apply a mask 2-3 nights a week. At an average of $12 a tub, that's less than $3 a month for the most effective skincare product I've ever used. I still can't for the life of me figure out how more people don't know about this stuff, and why something so HOLY GRAIL caliber is so darn inexpensive!<br />Update:<br />When my teenage daughter developed some age-related acne, this product worked wonders for her. I was hesitant for her to use straight apple cider vinegar on her young skin, so we used half distilled water and half ACV. I found than when using water, the clay doesn't mix up as smoothly- it tends to be lumpy. I get a better result when I dilute the ACV with distilled water FIRST, then add the diluted ACV to the clay (instead of adding water and ACV to the clay as two separate ingredients).<br />Also, when I am in the mood for a more cooling type of mask, I add 1 or 2 drops of tea tree oil to my mixture. I don't notice any difference in the effectiveness of the mask when I do this- I just like the way it feels. It adds a cool, tingly, freshening sensation while I'm waiting for the mask to dry.e ingredients). Also, when I am in the mood for a more cooling type of mask, I add 1 or 2 drops of tea tree oil to my mixture. I don't notice any difference in the effectiveness of the mask when I do this- I just like the way it feels. It adds a cool, tingly, freshening sensation while I'm waiting for the mask to dry.

  2755. THIS PRODUCT IS SERIOUSLY THE GOD OF ALL GODS!! I'm slowly switching over to more gentle and natural products for my skin and this \\"healing\\" clay really lives up to its name. It comes in powder form, which is good because you will be able to mix a fresh new batch of clay every time you want to use a mask. I use a spoon to scoop some out and then mix it with organic apple cider vinegar until I get the right consistency. I use a makeup brush to apply it all over my face and I apply a thicker layer to areas where I break out most or where my pores are the largest. I let it dry about 10-15 minutes or until it feels uncomfortably tight before washing it off. TAKE NOTE: Be really careful how you wash the mask off your face. I heard that if you wash everything down the drain, you can easily clog your sink. I use a big pan of water to dip my face in and then wipe off with paper towels. It's not hard to take off but you just have to remember to make sure none if it goes down the drain.<br /><br />I cannot begin to express how satisfied I am with this product. After using it, my face feels really soft and my pores have noticeably closed up. I've also noticed that I seem to be breaking out less. I think most people use it about once a week but I use it twice a week because of my acne. Be careful not to use it too often or it would dry out your skin. Apple cider vinegar is also good for acne and dark spots, so it's a good combination to try out if you have acne-prone skin. However, apple cider vinegar doesn't smell that good -_- You can also mix the clay mask with water.<br /><br />I'm so happy that I found out about Indian Clay Masks because they do wonders for my skin! I haven't found a product that works better than this. I will definitely purchase again!<br /><br />Good: works really well, closes pores, doesn't break out my skin, oil control<br /><br />Bad: if you're not careful, you can clog your sink with this! it is very easy to remove but for someone lazy like me, it can be a pain (but still worth the effort!)oil control<br /><br />Bad: if you're not careful, you can clog your sink with this! it is very easy to remove but for someone lazy like me, it can be a pain (but still worth the effort!)

  2807. First off, I want to point out all the people who gave bad reviews. They all said the same thing: the clay mask is bringing all the acne and blackheads to the surface of their skin!<br />IT'S SUPPOSED TO DO THAT.<br />By bringing all the impurities to the surface, its helping to get rid of them by getting your pores to excrete them quicker. So yes, you will break out for the first few days. But that's just the first step.<br />Honestly, I love this stuff. I only have been using it for a week on a daily basis (I have moderate/severe acne and acne scarring) and my face feels great. My acne did get worse after the first few days, but it's getting progressively better and better! A lot of the people complain about chunks in their masks, but there is an easy solution. I am a ceramics major, so I know how clay works. Just prepare and mix what you need the day before, and then mix it again before you use it. Your water/vinegar will have evenly distributed itself by then in the clay, and you should have little to no chunks. If you leave it for two days its even smoother after mixing; almost like it was whisked.<br />And again, its clay. Its going to smell a little funny. I work with clay on a daily basis, so I'm used to it (granted this stuff is way lighter in fragrance). And it will dry out your skin. So just use moisturizer afterward. I put on my acne lotion after, so it gets soaked up really fast.<br />5 stars people. This is great stuff. Would you really wanna put chemicals on your face when you can use a natural clay that does an even better job?

Calcium bentonite is technically volcanic.. It's pretty much creating an electric current when it's introduced to liquid. That's why it bubbles and you can't you metal utensils (metal is a conductor). Pretty neat. That's also why it draws out toxins. The charge grabs onto them. Regardless, it helps with my acne. (:

  2886. As an educated consumer, I am continually on a quest to find natural products/remedies for various things; especially when it comes to skin care as I have sensitive skin. I purchased this item after reading up on the benefits of bentonite clay. So far, I've used this item as both a facial mask and on an insect bite.<br /><br />As a facial mask, I think this stuff works fairly well. Just note that it is difficult to get smooth (so there are clumps, which makes it difficult to spread on your skin) and it will dry out your skin (so make sure you have a good moisturizer once you wash it off). With that said, I definitely saw a difference after using it a few times in terms of how my skin looked and felt. I myself don't really feel a tingly sensation other than the sensation I feel as it dries (which is typical for any type of mud/clay mask).<br /><br />Yesterday afternoon I noticed a large insect bite on my forearm. As someone who has a somewhat severe reaction to insect bites (flea bites looks like mosquito bites, mosquito bites look like spider bite, etc.,) I figured I mine as well try the clay to see how to works for this purpose. Well, sure enough, after letting it sit on the bite for about 15-20 minutes, I washed it off and noticed an immediate difference. The swelling had gone down significantly and the bite did not hurt anymore. By this morning, you can barely even see it. Usually it takes 2-3 days for bites to look the way it does in less than 24 hours when using the clay.<br /><br />With all this being said, I definitely recommend this clay for the various purposes described on the label.

  2888. So I was hesitant to try this product to begin with. I am 27 years old and I have horrible hormonal/adult acne with combination skin. My tzone is oily and my chin is usually dry. Clay products tend to exacerbate that 10 fold. Starting last year after switching to a new birth control, I really broke out all over my face. I felt like I was in high school again. It was absolutely horrifying. I was constantly anxious about my skin. I bought about every single product known to man for my face. I spent probably thousands of dollars to no avail, and it seemed either a product would make my face even worse, or only help slightly or for a short period of time. I began to pick my face obsessively. DO NOT EVER DO THIS...I cannot stress this enough. People at my workplace started to notice my worsening skin, and even commented to me about it. It only made my anxiety and face picking worse...<br /><br />On to present day....I decided to finally buy this product after reading hundreds of reviews and doing plenty of research. I figured I had nothing to lose at this point. The product came quickly and packaging was nice. I hesitated for several days to use the product...but finally I gave it a try! All I can say is wowwww! A few pointers...1. USE 100% non-filtered apple cider vinager....you will regret it if you dont. It is not harsh on the skin. 2. If you are like me and dry out using clay, put a capful of olive oil in with it as well...makes a huge difference. 3. I do not put on a 1/2 in of clay...a layer to cover the face is more than enough. 4. DO NOT use the mask once or twice and think because you see nothing yet it does not work. After the 4th day or so is when I finally noticed the drastic changes. 4. Almond oil or olive oil after the mask is a must. Like I said, the mask itself isn't drying, but the oils have healing properties that work magic while you sleep. 5. DO NOT freak out when your face is read afterwards for about 30 mins...its normal. 6. I recommend leaving the mask on until it dries...not the label that says 15-20 mins...usually takes me about 45 to an hour. I have been using it everyday for over a week now and I am in shock. My skin is glowing and beautiful. The oily tzone is at bay, and my dry flakey chin is getting better with each use. The awful pick marks/scabs are finally healing, my acne purged the first few days due to the mask pulling out the toxins and dirt, and now my blackheads and deep pimples are finally going away. I can't believe that I was so afraid to use this mask, and it is the one product that is working. I tossed my proactiv and all the other chemical crap in the trash today and made sure I got on here to write a review...which I barely ever do. You can crush an aspirin into the mask as well for hard to heal acne. I do not even need to do so, but I have read many people do so. Oh, few other tips. Use plastic spoon and plastic bowl to mix it. You should also watch your drains...I can bet this will clog it. So I try to get as much as I can peel off my face into the garbage.<br /><br />All and all people....TRY IT. For 8 bucks you can't go wrong. I am the queen of acne products and I gotta say, this is a miracle in a jar. Good luck! :)ask on until it dries...not the label that says 15-20 mins...usually takes me about 45 to an hour. I have been using it everyday for over a week now and I am in shock. The water and clay creates a clumpy and mess of a mask to put on that is difficult to spread. With the apple cider vinegar, there it is effortless to get the clay and vinegar to mix into a smooth velvety paste that goes on easily. Plus, the &#34;pulsations&#34; are more intense with the vinegar when compared to water.<br /><br />I recently tried this routine and it has done wonders for my face: (1) wash face as usual (2) exfoliate with one part olive oil and one part white sugar (3) wash face again to remove the oil (4) use this clay mask (5) rinse off (it comes off easiest if you use a wash cloth to collect water and splash it on your face just as you would if you were rinsing your face after washing it and using the cloth to gently remove the mask. It takes less than a minute to get it off this way) (6) moisturize<br /><br />Overall, after several uses, my pores are smaller, acne is less of an issue, and the blackheads on my nose are gone.   3021. I received my product a few weeks ago and have been using it almost daily since. I have recently started to mix my clay with hot distilled water and apply the mask while it is still warm which helps with the mixing and also opens up the pores on my face. This product does not seem pulsate or pull as strongly as the mask I made from the NOW brand bentonite (sodium type), nor did it draw as much blood to the surface of my skin, which is what causes the redness and/or burning sensation, but it does seem to help heal better. I will try mixing the two types of clay together for my facial masks as they seem to have different properties.<br /><br />I haven't noticed any change to the size of the pores on my face nor has daily use of this clay made my skin more or less oily or dry.   3022. While I like the idea that Aztec clay is natural and does not contain harmful chemicals, it was a lot of effort to: 1. Make it – clumps up, you have to stir it forever to make it right consistency. 2. Get it off. No wonder so many people reported that their skin really dried out with this. You have to wash and scrub your face and body for ages then STILL you might walk around with some green patches that you missed. It is really clingy. There will also come a time when you will have to decide if you prefer to have a clean face and blocked drain or the other way around. I mean, you have to pile on a lot of this stuff to get the desired result. How long can you keep it up? Nope, not for me. I am going back to my trusted Baiden Mitten which does everything that this clay promises to do but without any drawbacks. Even my husband had pointed out how much cleaner my face is getting. The instructions say to use once a week but I am using it twice a week and I don't feel like it is too much at all. The instructions also say to keep the mask on for 15-20 minutes but I keep it on for 45 minutes to an hour because otherwise I don't get that pulsating feeling. Also, If you put it on as thick as it suggests, it takes that much time to dry.<br /><br />I can feel the effects of the mask even when I am not using it. My pores are slowly releasing blackheads constantly which is great, but it does make my skin a bit greasier than it used to be now that all the grossness is coming out of my pores. What I do is use Olay Pore Minimizing Cleansing and Scrub twice a day (it keeps my combination skin moisturized and helps clean my pores between mask treatments). I also recommend using a moisturizer after taking off the mask (I use Garnier gellbased). I didn't think I was going to need since my skin is not dry but the mask does dry out your skin a lot after use. This is so cheap, I can't believe it works this well. If it keep going like this, I will continue to buy more!
