  3071. I am so in love with this Aztec Secret Indian Healing Clay Deep Pore Cleansing Mask. I would like to start off by saying I have dry skin and it has started becoming 'flaky' in some spots along my forehead. I have been diagnosed with a minor case of &#34;Psoriasis&#34; which has been flaking off and dry in some spots. This mask has changed my life significantly. I take a small mixing bowl and measure out a few spoons of the mask and a small teaspoon of Bragg's Apple Cider Vinegar & a tad bit of water, I mix it all up until I get a thicker consistensy ( I prefer a thicker mask then a thin layer ). I make sure my skin is completely clean and I have no make up, I use the Cetafil regular face wash and pat my skin dry. I apply this mask and let it sit for about 35-40 minutes (this is longer then normal, but the longer I want, the softer my skin is afterwards). You can literally feel your face pulsating and getting tight. It's incredible stuff & I will use this stuff for a very long time. =) I highly recommend this a couple times a week to deep cleansing.

  3073. One day, I noticed that I started getting very little pimple or some sort on my forehead. It happened right after I changed my shampoo. I went to see my PC since seeing a dermatologist would mean waiting for 4 months. I was prescribed some topical cream but that didn't solve the problem on my forehead. It actually caused another problem on my chin. I was getting painful cystic acne especially on the left side. I was getting a lot of them like 6-7 very close to each other. I've had acne my whole life pretty much and they never really bother me since they just came and went but these painful ones were totally different. I finally went to see a dermatologist and was prescribed doxi(?? antibiotic) and like a miracle, they went away but only to come back worse when I get off of that antibiotic. I didn't want to take the same medicine again since it only made the problem worse. Sure it would make it go away as long as I'm on it but who would want to be on antibiotic forever? Anyway, after reading the reviews, I decided to try this. Well, this is not panacea for acne. That's for sure. However, I think it does make it a bit better. I still have those painful cystic acne on my chin but they do seem to get a bit smaller in size if I keep using this thing. I also still have the little pimple thingy on my forehead but a bit better than before. I used this product maybe everyday for the first week and then every two or three days ever since then(it's been almost 2 months so far and I try to use it every 2 days unless my laziness holds me back). I do notice the difference when I use it every 2 days or every 3 days(or even when I skip a few days). My chin breakout gets worse when I don't use it as often as I should. Since I don't want to go on antibiotic again, this is pretty much my only way out to keep my painful acne under control and I do like it since it does seem to smooth out the non acne areas on my face. I will try to remember to leave the update after using it for more months in case someone is reading my review.<br /><br />UPDATE-Sep 17th, 2014<br />Okay, I finally used the whole 1lb jar.(I guess it took about 2 and a half months to use up that one pound jar for me).There were a couple of lazy weeks that I really didn't use this regularly but after getting more of the painful acne, I really tried hard to do it every 2 days. After about 3 weeks of doing that, I finally got rid of those painful ones about 90%. I do get small ones every now and then but they go away so quickly(like within a couple of days). I think I will try to use it every 3 days now instead of every 2 days and see if that still keeps the acne under control. I leave it on for 25-30 minutes. One time I think I left it on for like 40-50 minutes and I thought that actually dried out my skin a bit and it felt quite harsh on my skin. For me, I think 25-30 is the best.<br />I was very skeptical when I first heard about it and read so many positive reviews here. I only tried it thinking that I had nothing to lose even if it doesn't work. Now I know for sure it does work and it's darn cheap. Heck ya, it's much cheaper than going to see a doc and take medicine. I just ordered 2lb jar. I will update again after using that up. I wonder how long it would take this time.onths in case someone is reading my review.   3103. I read many of the reviews so I decided to mix my clay with raw Apple cider vinegar, first I placed three tablespoons (you only really need about 1.5 or 2 tbs max) of the powdered Aztec clay in a zip loc bag and then added equal parts Apple cider vinegar. I mixed it all up and then cut a hole at the bottom of the zip loc. I added the mixture to my face until it was about 1/2 inch thick on my face. I waited 15 min max, after results? My skin was beautiful, not dry or oily. I have combination skin, I am acne prone and my skin is also pretty sensitive. I did not have any small red bumps or a rash or any other side effects as some have stated in their review. I love the product and I will most likely buy more as soon as I am done with this batch! Thanks a lot!<br /><br />ATTENTION: when trying to wash this mask off do not attempt to wash it off like any regular mask. Listen to the other reviews which say the same thing!! What I did was I first closed the sink drain, put my large zip loc bag over my sink drain and then using wet wipes I added small amounts of water to it and then scrapped off the clay onto the sink. DO NOT LET THIS GO IN UR DRAIN! this stuff is hard, thick and dry! It will clog ur drain without a doubt.<br /><br />after I washed my face I realized it was not red, no red bumps like some had experienced, for me personally it made my skin super soft.   3113. I'm so shocked at how great this product is in just the short time that I had it.<br /><br />I read a bunch of reviews before finally deciding to go for it, but have some things to add.<br /><br />First, it takes some time to get used to the consistency of the clay and how to put it on your face because no matter what, it's clumpy. I have experienced with how much to use and I find that 1tsp clay with 1tsp and a couple extra drops water works well for me.<br /><br />I think take a small finger full and put it on my face and then move it around in a circular motion as this helps to break up the clumps.<br /><br />Next, I leave it on until it fully dries which is normally 45+ minutes.<br /><br />The I rinse it.<br /><br />Some reviews I read said don't get this in the sink- I was very scared at first but I assure you I've gotten a lot of it in the sink and nothing has happened.<br /><br />Now in terms of feelings, it seriously pulls your face. I find that it hurts a bit. I also read a review that suggested using a washcloth to get the clay off. I tried that tonight and not only did it hurt but it took much longer for me.<br /><br />Also, don't forget to moisturize.

  3115. Wow. Talk about a tight fit! This stuff molds onto your face and makes it to where you can't move your mouth. With that being said, it cleans out pores beautifully and does not over dry my skin. I wash with a gentle face wash before applying this. I mix mine with organic apple vinegar in a small bowl. The vinegar helps to clear up any bumps/acne since it offers a deeper clean. I also add little water to help dilute. I smear it down just below my jaw line so it can get the top of my neck where I get little bumps sometimes. I keep it away from my hair line, under my eyes, and eye brows. When I've finished applying I IMMEDIATLY scoop out what's left and put it in the trash (so the clumps don't clog my drain) and wash my little bowl and whatever I used to mix with down the sink making sure to use soap and plenty of hot water. I even let the water run a few extra seconds to make sure its plenty rinsed. I could see this stuff clogging drains like cement! I leave the mask on for about 15-20 minutes, or until it completely dries.<br /><br />All in all this is a great purchase and totally worth the money. The smell is not \\"spa\\" like as it's more of a dirt smell, but not over the top or anything. This has lasted me over a year so far and I still have plenty. I use it about twice a month. I would recommend this for sensitive, combination, oily and acne-prone skin.
  3116. I debated for a few weeks regarding whether or not to buy this item. I wanted to try it based on all of the positive reviews, but I was really skeptical as to whether or not the reviews were legit. Far be it from me to not try the latest and greatest skin-oriented snake oil, I bought it and anxiously waited for my mud miracle to arrive.<br /><br />Low and behold IT WORKS. I'm happy with this product for a lot of reasons, one of which is due to the relief I felt when I realized I didn't wind up being a total sucker. Whew. Anyhow, here are my ins and outs thus far:<br /><br />- I haven't tried it with vinegar, only water, and my pores were noticably smaller (like almost gone!) after the first use. This isn't a permanent fix, but my skin looks incredible after the redness goes away... which brings me to:<br /><br />- This stuff makes me red. I have a full face sunburn afterwards for at least an hour or two. I only use it at night before I go to bed because of this.<br /><br />- I mix exactly 50/50 powder to water ratio using only plastic bowl and utensil. Any time I've added too little water and tried to add more, it clumps very badly and its totally ridiculous, impossible to deal with and it will make you want to throw the whole unused jar away.<br /><br />- I don't use very much. The 1/4 to 1/2 inch mud layer instructions seem like overkill - my results have been the same and I've tried a super thick layer (I was bored) and a super thin application. A teaspoon of powder (not packed in) and a teaspoon of water was the perfect amount for a nice super thin layer.<br /><br />- It left my face squeaky clean, literally, and I've never had skin this clean or soft... ever. Rinse mud off with a lot of warm water (pat the dried mud with wet hands first to get the ball rolling), then use more water to massage it around and eventually rinse off fully. When all traces of mud are removed, do a final splash with cold water.<br /><br />- MOISTURIZE afterwards. No exceptions. My skin was totally dried out within 5 minutes of my first use, so I started moisturizing within a minute or two of rising it off and patting dry. My skin soaks up the moisturizer like a champ and looks brand new post-treatment.<br /><br />- If you have any blemishes or blackheads, they will come to the surface when using this mask. It's amazing (and yucky at the same time), but its the best way to get your pores flushed out.<br /><br />- I had a small breakout after first use. I expected this because it is detoxifying. I used it two days in a row and every single blemish I had disappeared.<br /><br />- It really does make your face pulsate. It's bizarre.<br /><br />- It's an amazing exfoliator and I'm not sure why since it isn't really gritty.<br /><br />- This is not a 'relaxing' treatment. If you invite your girlfriends over for a fun spa night to use this mud, they will kill you. It gets extremely tight and can get somewhat hot. Honestly, it pulls so tight across the bridge of my nose, it opened my sinuses. As far as I was concerned, all of the above was a small price to pay for the result. Amazing.<br /><br />I'm a happy customer and will definitely-absolutely-without-a-doubt be purchasing this again.was totally dried out within 5 minutes of my first use, so I started moisturizing within a minute or two of rising it off and patting dry. My skin soaks up the moisturizer like a champ and looks brand new post-treatment.<br /><br />- If you have any blemishes or blackheads, they will come to the surface when using this mask.   3126. Despite all the positive reviews, I was still skeptical when it came to something that worked on my skin. I don't get many pimples, but I usually get one or two incredibly painful, huge cystic nodules (I had one that made me look like Quasimodo, which was quickly healed by this stuff). Even if my skin would clear from one pimple, another one would spawn shortly afterwards. It was a never ending battle and I could never get it fully under control; I would always have at least one problem area.<br /><br />I've been using this twice a week (tuesdays/thursdays), mixed with water in a plastic baggie and I am SO pleased with the results. My method was pretty simple, just put water and some clay in a plastic bag and rub the bag so the contents are completely mixed all over the surface area of the inside of the bag, turn the bag inside out, and apply. I have not broken out since I started using this stuff two weeks ago and my pores have shrunk noticeably. I had a horrible patch of chest acne and I've only used the mask on it twice. About a week later, I haven't had any excess oil production and my chest acne has nearly healed completely. I notice that my skin way is less oily throughout the day, even on days where I haven't used a mask for 3 days. The mask is very penetrating and has helped me greatly with cystic acne.<br /><br />Despite the fact that the packaging was completely broken upon arrival, I salvaged about half of the contents and Amazon was quick to give me a refund. Afterwards, I use the Apple Cider Vinegar as a toner (1:1 ratio with water) and then apply my moisturizer. I left the product on until it was dried and had a cracked appearance. I took a damp washcloth and set it on my face to loosen the hardened clay. Once the clay was softened I wipped the clay away with the wet cloth.<br /><br />After removing the clay I noticed my skin was smooth, and the white/black heads around my nose were gone!   3218. I used Aztec for the first time over the weekend and it felt like a spa day for my hair!<br /><br />The jar arrived with anti-tampering seal. The powder is fine textured and has a soft mint-green/gray color. I measured a 1/4 cup of powder in a plastic container . Then, gradually stirred in 1/4 cup of diluted apple cider vinegar/water with a plastic spoon. Once the clay was smooth, I stirred in 1 tbsp of extra virgin olive oil. I applied the powder to my face and my previously deep conditioned hair.<br /><br />Application was very easy to both my face and my hair. and scalp. I put a plastic cap over my hair so that the clay wouldn't dry out. After 15 minutes, I rinsed my face and hair with very warm water. The clay rinsed out easily.<br /><br />My face was glowing and smooth. My hair had defined curls and felt soft. I was surprised to find that the 6-month old henna that I thought had grown out to the tips of my hair was vibrantly all over my hair. The clay revealed the henna again and I loved it!<br /><br />Definitely a keeper!

  3220. This is a great clay mask, but due to my busy life, I don't have much time to make it. Every time I've done it, I've made too much or it wasn't done the right way (too watery or the clay clumps too much). I need to work on making it better, yet it's more convenient to buy masks that are already premixed. Of course those may include more chemicals and ingredients, so if you are looking for a natural clay mask, this is it. However, if making a mask and figuring out just how much you need (it's really not a lot needed if you're just applying on the face, which is all I need) is not a problem, then I say go for it.<br /><br />Applying the mask after it's done is pretty simple. I mix in a glass bowl and use my fingers to spread the clay around. You start to feel it dry fairly quick, but after about 10 minutes, your whole face feels pulsating. They're not lying when they advertise that. It's a strange sensation, but I guess it's what it's supposed to do. After rinsing, my skin is a little red, but that goes away after awhile. But I don't recommend to do a mask right before going out.<br /><br />Since I've gotten it (about 3 months ago), I've only done 4 facial masks, since for me it's a bit of a hassle to make the mask right. I honestly don't feel a difference from this product to any other clay mask I've bought. It does dry my out a little more than others do, but in regards to my pores or acne, it works just fine. It's not extraordinary, but it's not ordinary either. The nicest thing is the large amount of clay you get for the price!

  3254. I used this product for almost a year now, and have finally decided to write this review. I absolutely love this clay. It works like a miracle. If you take half a teaspoon of this clay powder, you will actually have enough mixture to use on your entire face (and maybe neck too - depending on how tiny your face is)!<br />I ordered the 1 pound container, and I can honestly say, it will last me an entire year... if not more!<br />CON: I've tried using it as a hair mask, and it leaves my hair really dry and feels really rough. I would not recommend using it on your hair, since it will take out all your hair's natural oil and will leave your hair oiler since your hair is trying to restore all the lost oil by producing more oil. So I wouldn't recommend using it on your hair. BUT, definitely use it on your face, neck, arms, legs, etc. Also, the first few times you use this, your face will turn red and you will get even more breakouts. But those breakouts are just those dirt that have been stuck in your pores and are finally submerging and causing breakouts. So don't be alarmed the first few times you use them. Your skin will get better after the first few uses!!!!

Many acne products and face masks can cause Seb Derm flare ups. This clay mask has been great for me. I use it at night because it can leave my face a little red. However, in the morning my skin feels and looks so much better. It does a great job at helping me maintain both, acne and Seborrheic Dermatitis.
  3260. all you really need is a tiny jar of this stuff. my complexion does look better after i use this. i use a non alcoholic witch hazel (the real kind) after rubbing the mask off. it takes the redness out of skin if you are fair complected. it tightens pores a bit, but i wouldn't say it &#34;deep cleans pores&#34;. maybe if your pores aren't that big to begin with.

  3263. This stuff works miracles! I am 23 years old, and I have been struggling with cystic acne for 10 years. I've tried everything from antibiotics, to OTC washes, to natural remedies from Pinterest, and nothing has worked for me. I purchased this product last week, I have done only three masks, and already, these stubborn, cystic bumps that have been embarrassing me and haunting me for the past 10 years have disappeared, and I'm starting to see the red marks go away as well.   3264. Ok, like many of the other reviewers, I've had acne for a very, very long time. I'll be turning 30 this year, and I'm still dealing with acne. I've also had uneven skin tone with dry spots. I wanted a product that was non-toxic and would be more of an all-in-one face mask. I got exactly what I requested, and I'm now on my second jar.<br /><br />I do want to say that I find the more regular I use the product, the better the results. That would seem like a &#34;duh!&#34; thing to some, but I can tell when I haven't used the product in a week or longer. Acne that I had that was starting to develop just disappears. My skin smooths out. My face feels great afterwards. This is an excellent product!<br /><br />I do have a couple tips though that make this product more effective.<br /><br />1) Buy one of those mixing kits. They come with the little bowl, brush, mixer tool, and measuring spoons. I was using this with a plate or bowl and a hair color applicator brush (yeah yeah yeah).... just get a kit. It'll make things easier.<br />2) I've only used apple cider vinegar. It works good. Use it.<br />3) Clean your face of makeup before you use it. I get better results when I do.<br />4) Put it on before a shower. This is the part that gets a little tricky for me. I've tried to not do the &#34;before shower&#34; step, but I always end up making a HUGE mess in my sink and I always end up getting some in my hair no matter how hard I try not to. Then my hair gets wet trying to get it out of my hair, and I never can get it all out of my hair, so then my hair dries funny.<br />5) I used to think the longer I left the product on, the better. I think 20 minutes is a good maximum. Anything longer and it starts to really dry and hurt. Like, pull your hair from your skin, crack your face, peel skin of hurt.<br /><br />Follow those steps, and you're good to go.

  3287. I read many reviews about this product and so many people touted this as an absolute miracle product. One reviewer said it was no better than any other clay mask she used and I will have to agree with that reviewer. Now don't get me wrong it is a very good product, but I have had other clay masks that make my face pulsate and tightens my pores. I will say this tightened just a bit more though and made my caramel colored skin red for about 20 minutes.<br /><br />What this product has over other clay masks is that it comes in a powder form so you can control it's thickness and also being able to mix it with ACV is a definite benefit to the skin. I mixed mine with the ACV and it worked wonderfully.<br /><br />Mixing it according to the directions I didn't find it any more gunky for the sink than any other clay mask that I have used; therefore, I do not see any reason to go through all of the acrobatics to remove the mask that others suggest.<br /><br />I do see this product lasting a long time so the value for the money is definitely there.<br /><br />So bottom line, yes, I would recommend this product. For those of you who have never had a drying clay mask this is probably the best thing since sliced bread. For those of you who have used drying clay masks before it's not the miracle product others have claimed it to be. When you put it on you'll think to yourself - &#34;been there, done that&#34;.

  3312. Powerful stuff, but you have to use it correctly. To use as a mask it needs to be combined in equal parts with apple cider vinegar. The vinegar has to be a kind with the &#34;mother&#34; in it, like Bragg's, and not the cheap stuff. Don't mix with water because it won't be the proper pH. First time users, leave it on for around ten minutes so you don't overdo it. Even if it's not dry yet, it's still working. There is a very noticeable pulsing and your face will most likely be red afterwards, but it fades quickly. I wash this off in the shower as this does take a while to remove. That way I don't have to use a washcloth which causes too much irritation. When I use this at night, I find that any active acne has significantly decreased in size and redness by morning.

  3351. I was waiting for a while to write this review, to make sure I could leave the best advice/ experience/ feedback for others who are looking for something to help with their acne. To start off I never had acne until I was 21. I was one of those who would go to bed with makeup on and only wash my face when I was in the shower. Then when I started breaking out all over my face I started trying everything I could find to work even proactive, nothing was helping or if a product was it would stop working for me. So basically where I am at now I only wash my face with water twice a day, mostly cold water, every now and again I will use warm water to open my pores then I will close them with cold water. I started using no chemicals on my face except occasionally makeup( if I have to) on June 17th, I also did this mask with Apple cider vinegar, I used once a day 4 days in a row. The mask really helped at first, but I kept breaking out, so I went down to using it twice a week. For some reason I felt like I still wasnt reaping the benefits like everyone else had b/c I was still breaking out after using it. So then I tried using this mask with water and only doing it once a week, that helped a lot! I was able to go a couple weeks with no breakout. It is July 31st and this is my regimen now and this is what is working for me. I get maybe a pimple or two now around my cycle time and that's it! no more chemicals on my face it took a while for my face to get used to it but it is worth it. If you want to know more just Google the caveman method, although I didn't go without putting water on my face because I want to be able to splash my face before I go to bed or after I wake up, like my boyfriend does and he doesn't have any pimples. Just think about it, our faces are freaking out b/c were putting unnatural things on them which absorbs in the body and bloodstream, and the face is only trying to fight the invaders similar to how white blood cells react. So I dunno I'm not a professional this is only a theory, and what only makes sense to me, so hopefully this will help others out too. Bottomline is I will keep using this mask with just splashing water on my face. It isn't a miracle product but it does great for tightening things and acne scarring, and the best part is it's all natural.ional this is only a theory, and what only makes sense to me, so hopefully this will help others out too. Bottomline is I will keep using this mask with just splashing water on my face. It isn't a miracle product but it does great for tightening things and acne scarring, and the best part is it's all natural.

My acne is hormonal and currently I have it about 85% under control and I have faith that it will only get better.   3389. I bought this because of the high volume of high-rated reviews and thought I would put this up against Queen Helene Mint Julep Masque. In my eyes this product failed miserably and I now have a container of this stuff that sooner or later will end up in the trash.<br /><br />First off, this is a powder that needs to be mixed. I knew this going in, but want this to be clear to those that might not have realized. Being a powder you need to mix the appropriate parts, otherwise it will be too thick or too thin. The instructions say you can use water or vinegar, I chose water and had a hard time mixing and getting rid of the clumps. After several minutes of mixing I gave up and just started applying.<br /><br />Incidentally, the tingly and pulsating comments by others is very valid. I noticed the sensation as the product started to dry. It gave me a glimpse of hope, thinking that all the prep work would be worth it and become some magical potion.<br /><br />Rinsing off the product is much more difficult than the product I was comparing it to and was annoyingly stubborn. It did not &#34;thin&#34; well and resulted in clogging my sink drain because the clumps where small enough to make it past the sink stop but collected somewhere in the pipe. I had to snake my drain after to get proper flow back.<br /><br />All in all, I would not recommend this product. I gave it 2 stars because it does seem to have some benefit of usage, however the cost (monetary and residual) will keep me away. My original choice will remain my go-to product as I am happy with it, just figured I would try this one out because of its popularity. If you have not tried Queen Helene Mint Julep Masque, its worth a shot. Its easy to apply, easier to remove (can still be a bit difficult at times), does not clog the drain and can be had at a local drug store if you cannot wait for it to be shipped through amazon.

I mix all the ingredients together in a little plastic baggy, massage it all around, and scoop out the necessary amount from there. The clay goes on very smoothly and is refreshing on the face. I felt a little tingling sensation, probably from the added stuff, that was very nice. I let the clay dry on my face and upper portion of neck for about 15 minutes, until dry, and then washed off with warm water and a cloth towel. It tends to be a little difficult to get off the face, but that's clay for you, and the result is a squeaky clean face. I follow this mask with cleanser and moisturizers.<br />Overall, I like the product--I think there is a lot of the clay inside the jar to last a long time.   3529. Great face mask. This is my first time i am using any clay packs and also my first time that I am tempted to put on my face pack every 4-5 days...haha..Strong mask that helps in deep cleansing of skin and improving fairness. Washing it off is definitely a problem but i am okey with it as I think this mask has really added glow to my face. I have a very dry skin and never had any issues with black head. So, I do not know how it helps with it. After I take the mask off I put rosehip seed oil on my face for moisturizing. I saw in comments that many of us are having problem in making fine paste out of it. I have never had that issue with mine so what I do with it might help others as well. I take the clay and add water/vinegar and let it steep for about 5 minutes (i usually wash my face during this time). I come back to the clay and add some more water and make a paste out of it. It turns into a smoother paste. If we add a few (2-3) drops of some face oils, the paste becomes really smoother. I found one awesome facemask recipe while going through some videos and I am really in love with it.<br /><br />Half spoon seaweed kelp powder (i use organic ones)<br />one spoon Aztec healing clay<br />quarter spoon (or less) of vitamin c crystals<br />Mix all those together and add water to make it of required consistency.<br />Add a drop of tea tree oil and 3-4 drops of jojoba oil or any oil of your preference.<br />Mix all those together and apply to your face and wash it off after 20-25 minutes or keep it on until you feel comfortable.<br />You can adjust the quantities as you wish coz ratios that work perfectly for one skin might not be same for others.<br />Enjoy beautiful glowing skin.

When I Shower, I get a hand towel and slowly press on my face, and rinse the towel. Little by little the mask will come off. I Do this so I don't just peel and clog my drain.<br /><br />I would Recommend at first, to leave it for 15 minutes. Your face WILL get Itchy..   3617. Good: I love this product enough to write a review about it-- i think this is my first good review in 5 years! My acne-prone skin hasn't felt this good since before puberty. I use it 4 times a week and have hardly broken out since. Truly live changing.<br /><br />Bad: Messy! The mask will arrive as a dry mix. Instructions suggest mixing with apple cider vinegar. I mixed with water for the first few days and the result was a clumpy, watery mess and it was impossible to shape it into a nice, spreadable paste. Also, it can be painful if you let it dry to long, especially if you apply a thinner layer towards the outer edges of your face/wherever you apply the mask because the pull is SO INTENSE as it hardens. It will also crack and leave lines on your face if you laugh/make a face and then let it harden.<br /><br />Tips:<br />1. Get Apple Cider Vinegar. i use distilled, whatever. Just dont use only water.<br />2. Let it dry completely at least every other time you use it. It needs thirty minutes to dry.<br />3. Do it alone so you wont be tempted to laugh/talk/interact in any way that will make the mask crack and pull in painful directions<br />4. Make sure you apply an EVEN layer. Pay special attention to the outer edges and make sure they aren't too thin, or they will dry first and pull the hardest.<br />5. Avoid delicate skin around the eyes and areas over your temples. The pull is so intense when it hardens completely. That little bit of skin by your temples needs to stretch to accommodate to the other skin around it (forehead and cheeks) I leave another space over my nose between my eyes.

  3634. I've had a lot of facials and masks so I was interested to see results with this product. My skin is combination and I have acne scars from my teenage experience. I've also had laser, fills (once) and acid peels over the years.<br />This was by far the most intense mask I've ever had, in terms of how tight my face got. Maybe that means I really needed it! :)<br /><br />Folks: to make easy on / off here's a suggestion that works great and a method esthetecians use:<br />1. Take a small ceramic ramekin (2 inch) and a popsicle stick to stir and smooth out lumps with apple cider vinegar. I keep a $1 ramekin for my masks, fyi. It takes 3 seconds to prepare.<br />2. Apply with your index and middle fingers into a thin layer once it's an opaque green tinge is fine (not translucent)<br />3. Wait 15 minutes. Feel your skin tighten and pulsate.<br />4. Take 2 paper towels and thoroughly wet. Take a dry paper towel and line the inside of the sink to catch falling mask<br />5. Take wet paper towels and gently open and place on your face, with your headed slightly tilted back, so that the entire towel is covering your face.<br />6. Slowly press each section of your face so the moisture transfers to your face. Then slowly massage one section at a time to remove the mask. Fold towel in half, massage, repeat. Fold towel in half again, massage, repeat. Repeat with a fresh wet towel until all mask is removed. I had to use 2 towels twice.<br />7. Rinse your face to remove any final residue. Gently towel dry.<br />8. Apply toner. Let dry.<br />9. Apply a lovely non pore clogging moisturizer<br />10. Notice your lovely smooth skin!!<br />Loved it!
